description: The default value should be:
'%N %t %S/%P:%p.%c' -> when ATM/DSL is used
'%N %t %S/%P:%v' -> when Ethernet/DSL is used
It is up to the customer, to select the needed informations from this list and
use a meaningfull combination. Also a combination with free text is possible.
Note:
The total length of all selected format strings, including those that will
be replaced dynamically by text during runtime, must not exceed the available
length of the circuitid (63 characters).
Any characters exceeding the maximum length will be truncated.
In addition output of numeric format strings can be controlled by
leading decimal digits or minus character '-' (e.g. '%05s' leads to
'00201' or '%-5c' leads to '32 '). This 'formatting' feature is not available for
strings which will be replaced by protocol agents (like %v)!
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgeBaseCircuitIdFormat

If unrestricted mode is active - the communication between subscribers becomes available.

default: enable in R2.0, disable in R2.3 / R2.5.x

enableUs(3) -> enable only upstream direction

description: The interval of ARP resolution for IPoA Bridgeport
If the value is 0, it means NE does not send any arp request to an ipoa provider edge router
after the router ip address is resolved. Thus, if the ipoa provider edge router's MAC address
is changed, packet uses wrong MAC address for ipoa provider edge router.

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortControlTimeStamp

description: IfIndex of the underlaying Interface in the interface-table, Also LAG-bridgePorts will
be modeled in the interface table.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheSubLayerIndex

description: Only used in case the bridgePort represents a PVC, otherwise equal 0. This value represent the
the index for sheAdslVccTpTable, sheXdslVccTpTable or sheShdslVccTpTable depending on ifType
of underlaying physical interface.
This index was build by the following rule:
index = (SubLayerIndex << 4) + Vcc-Number
Lowest value for she is 0x0651 (ifIndex = 101 and Vcc-Number 1).
Highest value for she is 0x6EC8 (ifIndex = 1772 and Vcc-Number 8).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheSubLayerCircuit

description: The PVID of the port (used as outer tag in doubleTagged mode).
Possible range is 1-4093.
This value points to the corresponding vlanIndex of the sheVlanTable.
The default value for subscriber bridgePorts follows an NE internal rule.
Uplink and LAG bridgePorts use PVID 1 as default.
Remark:
Notice, that traffic forwarding will only be possible if the corresponding VLAN exist in the NE
and this bridgeport is member of it!
With R3.7M the default PVID value is 1 for ALL types of bridgeports.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortPVID

description: Default Priority of the bridgePort.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortPriority

description: defaults:
Dsl PVC : subscriber(4)
Adsl special: vccAggregatorNotUsed(20)
Uplink : upLink(2)
Lag : notUsed(1) -> new with R3.8M: notUsedUplink(7)
If upLink-Port is aggregated, the upLink state moves to aggregated(5) and the Lag moves to uplink(2).
If a physical bonding is used (Shdsl 4wire/6wire/8wire done over shdsl configuration, m-pair bonding)
the master bridgeport changes his usage to physbondedSubscriber(13) and all other members to notUsed(1).
If a gbond bonding is used (via she-bonding-mib configuration), the master bridgeport-entry of the new
bonding port changes his usage to bondingSubscriber(11) and all other members of bonding port to bondingNotUsed(10).
For the feature singleMacMultipleVcc, it is possible to aggregate two or more single VCC's of one
physical adsl-link to the vccAggregator. The usage of the single PVC - bridgeports (subscriber)
could be set to vccAggregated(22) and the special bridgeport change his usage
from vccAggregatorNotUsed(20) to vccAggregatorUsed(21) in that case.
It is also possible to set this special bridgeport usage directly and in that case all
bridgeports with identical sublayerindex will change her usage to vccAggregated(22).
This configuration has additional restrictions for PVID and priority configuration.
Check MSC for detailes.
R2.8 support IU10x1G as subtending card. The usage of related bridgePorts will be cascading(3).
R3.7M now support also UNI interfaces on this board type - for that the usage of related
bridgePorts could be modified to subscriber(4).
CXU uplink and LAG interface related bridgeports could be configured to cascading(3).
R3.8M/R4.7M support two new values, which will be used for LAG related bridgePorts.
These usages contain additional information about the usage of the LAG bridgeport,
if they will be go activ:
notUsedUplink(7) -> uplink(2)
notUsedCascading(8) -> cascading(3)
NOTE:
New in R3.8M/R4.7.1M is the parameter sheBridgePortOperPortUsage which reports the current
operative port usage of the port.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortUsage

description: The configuration protocol(s) that may be used by a host.
VALUES
none(0)
useDHCP(1)
usePPPoE(2).
useDHCPandPPPoE(3)
NOTES
- This object is deprecated; the use of sheBridgePortHostConfigProtocolPermission
should be preferred.
- Changes in the value of this columnar object will trigger corresponding changes
in the value of sheBridgePortHostConfigProtocolPermission columnar object and
vice versa.
- This object reports only a subset of possible host configuration protocols and
does not include IPv6-specific host configuration protocols; these only be
configured via sheBridgePortHostConfigProtocolPermission.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: Status set to deprecated; to be superseded by
sheBridgePortHostConfigProtocolPermission.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortHostConfigurationProtocol

description: Needed for special Options in DHCP or PPPoE.
If not configured the default format string from sheBridgeBaseCircuitIdFormat
will be used.
Note:
The total length of all selected format strings, including those that will
be replaced dynamically by text during runtime, must not exceed the available
length of the circuitid (63 characters).
Any characters exceeding the maximum length will be truncated.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortCircuitId

description: The permitted maximum number of MAC addresses per bridgeport.
Cannot be modified for uplinks.
Special values:
-1 - 'unlimited': disables MAC address limitation, whereby
the actual limit depends on the respective card type:
Convergate-based : 63
Wintegra-based : 64
GE/FE : limited by FDB
ngVDSL : 1024
0 - disables dynamic MAC address learning; static FdbTable
entries still possible
Default values:
Uplinks : unlimited (cannot be modified).
Subscribers : 16
IMPORTANT
The supported configuration values depend on the type of IU
card on which the bridgeport resides as summarized below.
Card type | unlimited | disable | Min | Max
Convergate-based IU | Yes | Yes | 1 | 63
Non-Convergate-based IU | Yes | Yes | 1 | 64
IUFE | Yes | Yes | 1 | 64
IU1GE | Yes | - | - | -
ngVDSL | Yes | Yes | 1 | 1024
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1 V1.565: Updated for card type ngVDSL.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortMaxLearnPermitCount

description: Mode of this bridgeport useIpoE, useIpoA, usePPPoA or useAuto.
useIpoE is the default setting. This mode will also support PPPoE.
useIPoA is only possible for IU_ADSL or IU_SHDSL boards.
If no MacAddress is configured in the corresponding MacProfileTable-entry, the NE
will autogenerate a own value.
In case of usePPPoA, the IU will translate the PPPoA protocol to PPPoE.
This configuration is only valid for bridgeports with SubLayerIndex placed on
IU_ADSL72 with IFX chipset! A SrcMac-address in sheBridgeIUProfileTable has to
be configured for the IU where these port is placed on.
The configuration useAuto forces the IU to start a autodetection mode for supporting PPPoA or
PPPoE.
New with R4.7M:
-> useAtmoE(4) -> new mode for ATM-PWE3 support
-> this is NOT a configurable value here and will be set on base of
NE internal configuration on the underlaying subLayerCircuit (VccTp)
-> if activated, this parameter is not longer configurable
-> if activated, the parameter InnerPVID will be set to a predefined value and is not longer configurable
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortMode

description: Configures the tagging mode of the bridgeport which
determines which incoming frames are admitted and processed
and, therefore, is only applicable to incoming frames.
Tagging of outgoing frames depends on both the
sheBridgeBaseTaggingMode and on the tagging defined
by the bridgeport's VLAN membership.
VALUES
taggedAndUntagged(0)
This mode is the default for uplink ports and should
not be changed for these ports.
Admitted frames : untagged, tagged and priority
tagged*
Untagged frames : tagged with PVID and forwarded
VLAN-tagged frames : forwarded unchanged.
Priority-tagged frames : PVID added and forwarded.
tagged(1)
Admitted frames : tagged and priority tagged*
Untagged frames : dropped
VLAN-tagged frames : frames tagged with previously
configured VLAN IDs (PVID, VLAN
membership) are forwarded
unchanged;
frames tagged with VIDs not
configured for the bridgeport
are dropped;
if the VLAN ID of an incoming
frame with a specific VLAN ID
should be replaced by the PVID
of the bridgeport, this can be
configured via
sheBridgePortReplaceTag.
Priority-tagged frames : PVID added and forwarded.
untagged(2)
This mode is the default for subscriber ports.
Admitted frames : untagged and priority tagged*
Untagged frames : tagged with PVID and forwarded.
VLAN-tagged frames : dropped
Priority-tagged frames: PVID added and forwarded.
priorityTaggedOnly(3):
This mode is available from R3.7M.
Admitted frames : priority tagged*
Untagged frames : dropped
VLAN-tagged frames : dropped
Priority-tagged frames: PVID added and forwarded.
taggingProfile(5) :
This mode is available from R4.7M.
Tagging is controlled Extended VLAN Mapping (EVM) profile
referenced by sheBridgePortEvmProfile.
NOTES
* if support of priority tagged frames is enabled via
sheBridgePortPrioTaggedMode, which is supported from R3.7M.
RESTRICTIONS
Modes taggedAndUntagged(0), tagged(1), untagged(2) and
priorityTaggedOnly(3) are only effective when
sheBridgeBaseTaggingMode = singleTag(1).
In R4.7M, R4.7.1M, R4.7.2M taggingProfile(5) is only
possible, if sheBridgeBaseTaggingMode = doubleTag(2).
REVISION HISTORY
R4.7.3M: sheBridgeBaseTaggingMode = doubleTag(2)
restriction for taggingProfile(5) removed.

description: The values uplink(2), cascading(3), and subcascading(6) could be interchanged.
For the feature singleMacMultipleVcc, it is possible to aggregate two or more single VCC's of one
physical adsl-link to the vccAggregator. The usage of the single PVC - bridgeports (subscriber)
could be set to vccAggregated and the special bridgeport change his usage
from vccAggregatorNotUsed to ..Used in that case.
It is also possible to set this special bridgeport usage directly and in that case all
bridgeports with identical sublayerindex will change her usage to vccAggregated.
This configuration has additional restrictions for PVID and priority configuration.
Check MSC for detailes.
All other changes will be done by NE automatically based on other configurations.
R3.7M allow now additionaly the interchange of usage cascading(3) and subscriber(4) for
bridgePorts placed on IU10x1G, because this IU type support now NNI and UNI interfaces.
CXU uplink and LAG interface related bridgeports could be configured to cascading(3).
R3.8M/R4.7M support two new values, which will be used for LAG related bridgePorts.
These usages contain additional information about the usage of the LAG bridgeport,
if they will be go activ:
notUsedUplink(7) -> uplink(2)
notUsedCascading(8) -> cascading(3)

description: That is a list of possible 16bit protocol type field's of the ethernet frames.
The octet string is a list of two octet entries each identifying an ethertyp value.
The least significant byte is the second octet.
The octet string has a variable length of up to 16 octets (max. 8 ethertypes in the list).
examples:
0x0800 IP Internet Protocol (IPv4)
0x0806 Address Resolution Protocol (ARP)
0x8100 VLAN Tag (VLAN)
0x8863 PPPoE Discovery
0x8864 PPPoE Session
The VlanMapping is applied to upstream frames matching this Ethertype's.
Other frames are forwarded unchanged.

description: This configuration enable/disable the feature IpAntispoofing on bridgePort base.
Depending on the used mode, the IU could made the following checks:
offIpAs(0) -> IpAs disabled
onIpAsNoVlanCheck(1) -> IpAs enabled, Only frames with configured Ip will be forwarded.
onIpAsInnerVlanCheck(2) -> IpAs enabled, Only frames with configured couple Ip-InnerTag will be forwarded.
onIpAsOuterVlanCheck(3) -> IpAs enabled, Only frames with configured couple Ip-OuterTag will be forwarded.
onIpAsBothVlanCheck(4) -> IpAs enabled, Only frames with configured triple Ip-InnerTag-OuterTag will be forwarded.
All other frames will be discarded.
Bridgeports on IU cards with wintegra chipset will not check any Vlan dependencies, don't care which
onIpAsxxx - mode was selected. Only cards with convergate chipset will made the requested differentiation.
There is an additional global switch for IpAs available (sheIpAntiSpoofingEnable)
which will outvote this configuration if set to 'enable'.
The configuration of the valid triple Ip-InnerTag-OuterTag will be done via
DHCP or StaticIpAddress configuration.
New parameter with SHE R2.8.

description: IfIndex of the underlaying Interface in the interface-table, Also LAG-bridgePorts will
be modeled in the interface table.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheSubLayerIndex

description: Only used in case the bridgePort represents a PVC, otherwise equal 0. This value represent the
the index for sheAdslVccTpTable, sheXdslVccTpTable or sheShdslVccTpTable depending on ifType
of underlaying physical interface.
This index was build by the following rule:
index = (SubLayerIndex << 4) + Vcc-Number
Lowest value for she is 0x0651 (ifIndex = 101 and Vcc-Number 1).
Highest value for she is 0x6EC8 (ifIndex = 1772 and Vcc-Number 8).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheSubLayerCircuit

description: The PVID of the port (used as outer tag in doubleTagged mode).
Possible range is 1-4093.
This value points to the corresponding vlanIndex of the sheVlanTable.
The default value for subscriber bridgePorts follows an NE internal rule.
Uplink and LAG bridgePorts use PVID 1 as default.
Remark:
Notice, that traffic forwarding will only be possible if the corresponding VLAN exist in the NE
and this bridgeport is member of it!
With R3.7M the default PVID value is 1 for ALL types of bridgeports.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortPVID

description: Default Priority of the bridgePort.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortPriority

description: defaults:
Dsl PVC : subscriber(4)
Adsl special: vccAggregatorNotUsed(20)
Uplink : upLink(2)
Lag : notUsed(1) -> new with R3.8M: notUsedUplink(7)
If upLink-Port is aggregated, the upLink state moves to aggregated(5) and the Lag moves to uplink(2).
If a physical bonding is used (Shdsl 4wire/6wire/8wire done over shdsl configuration, m-pair bonding)
the master bridgeport changes his usage to physbondedSubscriber(13) and all other members to notUsed(1).
If a gbond bonding is used (via she-bonding-mib configuration), the master bridgeport-entry of the new
bonding port changes his usage to bondingSubscriber(11) and all other members of bonding port to bondingNotUsed(10).
For the feature singleMacMultipleVcc, it is possible to aggregate two or more single VCC's of one
physical adsl-link to the vccAggregator. The usage of the single PVC - bridgeports (subscriber)
could be set to vccAggregated(22) and the special bridgeport change his usage
from vccAggregatorNotUsed(20) to vccAggregatorUsed(21) in that case.
It is also possible to set this special bridgeport usage directly and in that case all
bridgeports with identical sublayerindex will change her usage to vccAggregated(22).
This configuration has additional restrictions for PVID and priority configuration.
Check MSC for detailes.
R2.8 support IU10x1G as subtending card. The usage of related bridgePorts will be cascading(3).
R3.7M now support also UNI interfaces on this board type - for that the usage of related
bridgePorts could be modified to subscriber(4).
CXU uplink and LAG interface related bridgeports could be configured to cascading(3).
R3.8M/R4.7M support two new values, which will be used for LAG related bridgePorts.
These usages contain additional information about the usage of the LAG bridgeport,
if they will be go activ:
notUsedUplink(7) -> uplink(2)
notUsedCascading(8) -> cascading(3)
NOTE:
New in R3.8M/R4.7.1M is the parameter sheBridgePortOperPortUsage which reports the current
operative port usage of the port.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortUsage

description: The configuration protocol(s) that may be used by a host.
VALUES
none(0)
useDHCP(1)
usePPPoE(2).
useDHCPandPPPoE(3)
NOTES
- This object is deprecated; the use of sheBridgePortHostConfigProtocolPermission
should be preferred.
- Changes in the value of this columnar object will trigger corresponding changes
in the value of sheBridgePortHostConfigProtocolPermission columnar object and
vice versa.
- This object reports only a subset of possible host configuration protocols and
does not include IPv6-specific host configuration protocols; these only be
configured via sheBridgePortHostConfigProtocolPermission.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: Status set to deprecated; to be superseded by
sheBridgePortHostConfigProtocolPermission.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortHostConfigurationProtocol

description: Needed for special Options in DHCP or PPPoE.
If not configured the default format string from sheBridgeBaseCircuitIdFormat
will be used.
Note:
The total length of all selected format strings, including those that will
be replaced dynamically by text during runtime, must not exceed the available
length of the circuitid (63 characters).
Any characters exceeding the maximum length will be truncated.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortCircuitId

description: The permitted maximum number of MAC addresses per bridgeport.
Cannot be modified for uplinks.
Special values:
-1 - 'unlimited': disables MAC address limitation, whereby
the actual limit depends on the respective card type:
Convergate-based : 63
Wintegra-based : 64
GE/FE : limited by FDB
ngVDSL : 1024
0 - disables dynamic MAC address learning; static FdbTable
entries still possible
Default values:
Uplinks : unlimited (cannot be modified).
Subscribers : 16
IMPORTANT
The supported configuration values depend on the type of IU
card on which the bridgeport resides as summarized below.
Card type | unlimited | disable | Min | Max
Convergate-based IU | Yes | Yes | 1 | 63
Non-Convergate-based IU | Yes | Yes | 1 | 64
IUFE | Yes | Yes | 1 | 64
IU1GE | Yes | - | - | -
ngVDSL | Yes | Yes | 1 | 1024
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1 V1.565: Updated for card type ngVDSL.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortMaxLearnPermitCount

description: Mode of this bridgeport useIpoE, useIpoA, usePPPoA or useAuto.
useIpoE is the default setting. This mode will also support PPPoE.
useIPoA is only possible for IU_ADSL or IU_SHDSL boards.
If no MacAddress is configured in the corresponding MacProfileTable-entry, the NE
will autogenerate a own value.
In case of usePPPoA, the IU will translate the PPPoA protocol to PPPoE.
This configuration is only valid for bridgeports with SubLayerIndex placed on
IU_ADSL72 with IFX chipset! A SrcMac-address in sheBridgeIUProfileTable has to
be configured for the IU where these port is placed on.
The configuration useAuto forces the IU to start a autodetection mode for supporting PPPoA or
PPPoE.
New with R4.7M:
-> useAtmoE(4) -> new mode for ATM-PWE3 support
-> this is NOT a configurable value here and will be set on base of
NE internal configuration on the underlaying subLayerCircuit (VccTp)
-> if activated, this parameter is not longer configurable
-> if activated, the parameter InnerPVID will be set to a predefined value and is not longer configurable
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortMode

description: Configures the tagging mode of the bridgeport which
determines which incoming frames are admitted and processed
and, therefore, is only applicable to incoming frames.
Tagging of outgoing frames depends on both the
sheBridgeBaseTaggingMode and on the tagging defined
by the bridgeport's VLAN membership.
VALUES
taggedAndUntagged(0)
This mode is the default for uplink ports and should
not be changed for these ports.
Admitted frames : untagged, tagged and priority
tagged*
Untagged frames : tagged with PVID and forwarded
VLAN-tagged frames : forwarded unchanged.
Priority-tagged frames : PVID added and forwarded.
tagged(1)
Admitted frames : tagged and priority tagged*
Untagged frames : dropped
VLAN-tagged frames : frames tagged with previously
configured VLAN IDs (PVID, VLAN
membership) are forwarded
unchanged;
frames tagged with VIDs not
configured for the bridgeport
are dropped;
if the VLAN ID of an incoming
frame with a specific VLAN ID
should be replaced by the PVID
of the bridgeport, this can be
configured via
sheBridgePortReplaceTag.
Priority-tagged frames : PVID added and forwarded.
untagged(2)
This mode is the default for subscriber ports.
Admitted frames : untagged and priority tagged*
Untagged frames : tagged with PVID and forwarded.
VLAN-tagged frames : dropped
Priority-tagged frames: PVID added and forwarded.
priorityTaggedOnly(3):
This mode is available from R3.7M.
Admitted frames : priority tagged*
Untagged frames : dropped
VLAN-tagged frames : dropped
Priority-tagged frames: PVID added and forwarded.
taggingProfile(5) :
This mode is available from R4.7M.
Tagging is controlled Extended VLAN Mapping (EVM) profile
referenced by sheBridgePortEvmProfile.
NOTES
* if support of priority tagged frames is enabled via
sheBridgePortPrioTaggedMode, which is supported from R3.7M.
RESTRICTIONS
Modes taggedAndUntagged(0), tagged(1), untagged(2) and
priorityTaggedOnly(3) are only effective when
sheBridgeBaseTaggingMode = singleTag(1).
In R4.7M, R4.7.1M, R4.7.2M taggingProfile(5) is only
possible, if sheBridgeBaseTaggingMode = doubleTag(2).
REVISION HISTORY
R4.7.3M: sheBridgeBaseTaggingMode = doubleTag(2)
restriction for taggingProfile(5) removed.

description: The operative port usage has changed.
New in R3.8M.
Reports the operative (bridge)port usage of the uplink or trunk bridgeport.
For some features, e.g., RSTP-based Dynamic Posrt Usage or LAG, the operative port usage
can differ from the administrative port usage configured in sheBridgePortUsage.
For example, when RSTP-based Dynamich Port Usage is enabled for network bridgeports or trunks
(via sheBridgePortDynamicPortUsageAdminState), the port will be adminstratively
configured as upLink(1), but dependent on the RSTP Port Role, the feature will change
the operative port usage to cascading(2); the administrative port usage as reported by
sheBridgePortUsage will remain upLink(1).
New in R3.8M/R4.7.1M.

description: This parameter select the basis for MAT on these IU. This will NOT enable the MAT feature
himself, but select the valid configuration for this IU.
If useMATperVlan (default) is selected, the settings of sheBridgePortMatEnabled will be ignored.
Only settings of sheVlanMatEnable are valid, if the VLAN is used on this IU.
If useMATperBridgeport is selected, the handling will be done in an opposite way.
If the used basis should be changed, a reboot of the corresponding IU may be needed to come operational.
New parameter with R2.8.

description: If configured unequal 0, the configured vlan-tag could be received and will be
replaced by PVID before forwarding the frame. A zero will disable this feature for this IU.
Only valid for IU Bridgeport's which are running tagged(1) mode and only if the NE
global tagging mode is singleTag.
NOTE:
New with R2.8. Configuration was moved from sheBridgePortTable.
The corresponding entry in the bridgeport table enable/disable the feature per bridgeport.

description: The parameter configure the common multiple VLAN tag acceptance.
Used to configure the maximum number of VLAN tags allowed in the received frame
for the configured services.
The VLAN admission policy shall be configured per service vlan.
The values 0..6 of the VLAN admission policy determine the exact number of max VLAN tags
allowed for a service VLAN in upstream.
The value 'unlimited (255)' allows any number of VLAN tags.
New parameter with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheVlanAdmissionPolicy

description: Configuration modified.
New with R4.7M.
The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheVlanControlTimeStamp

description: Indicate the kind of binding of the Bridge Feature Set.
0 -> this -> this outer vlan will be used for VSI lookup
-> all bridge feature settings are configured via this vlan table entry
1 -> inner -> doubleTagged traffic will use the inner tag for VSI lookup
-> all bridge feature settings for the inner tag should be set via sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentTable
-> If no entry for the inner IVID exist inside the sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentTable
the traffic will be discarded!
New parameter with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheVlanForwardingTypeDescriptor

description: This parameter describes the 'Learning And Forwarding Selector' - LFS.
0 -> The Learning and Forwarding of a frame will be done in the context of the outer vlan
1 -> The Learning and Forwarding of a frame will be done in the context of the inner vlan
New parameter with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheVlanLFS

description: Indicates whether interfaces whose traffic is carried in this VLAN can be
considered as trusted interfaces or untrusted interfaces with respect to DHCPv6.

true - interfaces connected to this VLAN can be trusted
false - interfaces connected to this VLAN cannot be trusted

R4.7.3M: Reserved for future use only.
SR5.1: Obsolete; sheBridgePortDhcpV6TrustedInterface to be used instead.

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentControlTimeStamp

description: A descriptive unique name for this feature set.
Spaces and other special characters (: ?) are not allowed!!
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentName

description: This parameter describes the handling of broadcast (bc), unknown multicast (umc)
and unknown unicast (uuc) traffic for a vlan. If cross connect mode is on
all these packets are flooded in the VLAN otherwise they are droped.
Valid values:
off(2) -> Cross Connect mode off
onBoth(3) -> Cross Connect mode on, flooding in downstream within the domain specified by both outer and inner Vid.
onOuter(4) -> Cross Connect mode on, flooding in downstream within the whole outer Vlan-domain
NOTE:
on(1) -> Cross Connect mode on : not supported in this context, please use either onBoth or onOuter.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentCCMode

description: This parameter is used to define which protocols are to be handled, if
a VLAN cross-connect mode has been configured (sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentCCMode).
This object is ignored, if sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentCCMode = off(2)
Additional protocol-related settings can be done within the protocol-specific
subgroups within this MIB.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentCCModeOptions

description: Enable or disable the mcast flooding.
Valid values:
off(2) -> Cross Connect mode off
onBoth(3) -> Cross Connect mode on, flooding in downstream within the domain specified by both outer and inner Vid.
onOuter(4) -> Cross Connect mode on, flooding in downstream within the whole outer Vlan-domain
NOTE:
on(1) -> Cross Connect mode on : not supported in this context, please use either onBoth or onOuter.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentMcastFlood

description: Enable or disable the MAC address translation feature.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentMatEnable

description: This parameter describes the 'Learning And Forwarding Selector' - LFS.
0 -> The Learning and Forwarding of a frame will be done in the context of the outer vlan
1 -> The Learning and Forwarding of a frame will be done in the context of the inner vlan
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgeFeatureSetAssignmentLFS

description: Look at table description.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBcmCardColourTableControlColourMarkingMode

description: look at table.
The value 0xFF can only be configured for one of the three DscpToColour mappings.
The value 0xFE cannot be configured for all of the three DscpToColour mappings at the
same time.
The default settings of the parameters sheBcmCardDscpToColourMappingForGreen (255),
sheBcmCardDscpToColourMappingForYellow (254), sheBcmCardDscpToColourMappingForRead (254)
mean that all received DSCP values will be interpreted as 'green' per default.

same time.

sheBcmCardDscpToColourMappingForYellow (254), sheBcmCardDscpToColourMappingForRead (254)
mean that all received DSCP values will be interpreted as 'green' per default.

$SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpRelayAdminStateModified SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpRelayAdminState i 1 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpControlReqResult i 2 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpControlTimeStamp u 9999

description: Globaly enable/disable of DHCP/PPPoE Agent for IPv4 only.
Telegram handling for DHCP and PPPoE
relay: valid telegrams are handled, invalid telegrams are dropped
snoop: valid telegrams are forwarded, invalid telegrams are dropped
bridge: valid telegrams are forwarded, invalid telegrams are forwarded (currently NO support)
dhcpPppoeRelayRelay -> dhcp and Pppoe use mode relay
dhcpPppoeRelaySnoop -> dhcp use mode relay and Pppoe use mode snoop
valid values:
up(1), -> releases >= R2.5 run now dhcpPppoeRelayRelay mode
down(2), -> releases >= R2.5 run now dhcpPppoeSnoopSnoop mode
dhcpPppoeRelayRelay(4)
dhcpPppoeRelaySnoop(5),
dhcpPppoeRelayBridge(6), (currently NO support)
dhcpPppoeSnoopRelay(7),
dhcpPppoeSnoopSnoop(8)
dhcpPppoeSnoopBridge(9), (currently NO support)
dhcpPppoeBridgeRelay(10),(currently NO support)
dhcpPppoeBridgeSnoop(11),(currently NO support)
dhcpPppoeBridgeBridge(12)(currently NO support)
NOTE:
Only release R2.8 and higher accept value's 4..12 depending on the state of implementation in NE.

description: Indicates the time stamp when the alarm notification was sent.
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmTimeAndDate

description: If applicable, indicates which instance of a component is
reporting the alarm. It is interpreted dependent on the
value of sheAlarmReportingSourceType as follows.
sheAlarmReportingSourceType | sheAlarmReportingSource
physicalEntity(1) | entPhysicalIndex
interface(2) | ifIndex
vccTp(3) | sheAdslVccTpIndex,
| sheShdslVccTpIndex
| sheXdslVccTpIndex
| (alarm OID determines scope)
vlan(4) | sheVlanIndex
bridgePort(5) | sheBridgePortIndex
erpDomain(6) | (obsolete)
voip(7) | sheVoipVgwIndex
vccTpShdsl(8) | (obsolete)
vccTpVdsl(9) | (obsolete)
l2cp(10) | sheL2cpIfIndex
syncSource(11) | sheSyncSourcePriority
pseudowire(12) | pwIndex
bfdSession(13) | (reserved for future use only)
syncT4Source(14) | sheSyncExtT4SourcePriority
voipSys(15) | (no relevance)
ntp(16) | (no relevance)
oamCfmMep(17) | (MaMegNetIndex << 16) + MepId
pseudowireGroup(18) | shePwVcRedGroupInstance
pmDataUpload(19) | sheSystemPMDataMaintenanceIndex
unknown(20) | (no relevance)
dataBaseBackup(21) | (no relevance)
igmpHistoryUpload(22) | entPhysicalIndex
swMaintenance(23) | (no relevance)
systemFileControl(24) | (no relevance)
systemConfigLog(25) | (no relevance)
vectoredSystem(26) | sheVectoredSystemIndex
vectoredCard(27) | entPhysicalIndex
vectorEnginePeer(28) | (sheVectoredCardVEPeerIndex << 24)
| + entPhysicalIndex
oamCfmGlobal(29) | (no relevance)
vectorEnginePort(30) | entPhysicalIndex
syncT4Out(31) | (no relevance)
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSource

description: Indicates the type or class of reporting source for the alarm.
Reporting source type determines how sheAlarmReportingSource
is to be interpreted. See sheAlarmReportingSourceType for a
full list.
A sheAlarmSeverityProfileEntry can be assigned to each
sheAlarmReportingSourceType within the MIB associated with
the sheAlarmReportingSourceType.
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSourceType

description: The severity of the alarm.
VALUES
critical(1)
major(2)
minor(3)
warning(4)
cleared(5)
Values 1..4 indicate that the alarm of the given severity has
been raised, the actual severity used being dependent on the
sheAlarmSeverityProfileEntry currently assigned to the
sheAlarmReportingSourceType.
Value 5 indicates that the alarm has been cleared.
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmSeverity

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpProviderAssignControlTimeStamp

description: The priority assigned to this rule.
This priority is used if various rules use overlapping VLAN ranges.
The rule with lowest priority value will take precedence if more than
one rule matches.Rules with identical priority value are not allowed
to use overlapping VLAN ranges.
The maximum number of allowed priorities depends on the maximum number
of possible rules.
VALUES
1..65535 - priority
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRulePriority

description: This configuration references an entry in the sheDhcpProviderTable
that is to be used for DHCPv4 by bridgeports when they are a member
of the VLAN identified by the given rule.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleProviderIndex

description: Name of the assigned provider table entry.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleProviderName

description: This configuration parameter specifies the beginning of the outer VLAN
range used to assign the DHCPv4 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the outer VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs beginning with this value.
4097 - special value: ignore outer VLAN; only the VID of the
inner VLAN is to be checked
NOTE
If this parameter is set to 4097, sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanEnd
will be ignored.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanBegin

description: This configuration parameter specifies the end of the outer VLAN
range used to assign the DHCPv4 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the outer VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs ending with this value.
4097 - special value: ignore outer VLAN; only the VID of the
inner VLAN is to be checked
NOTE
This parameter is ignored, if the sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanBegin
is set to 4097.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanEnd

description: This configuration parameter specifies the beginning of the inner VLAN
range used to assign the DHCPv4 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the inner VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs beginning with this value.
4096 - special value: indicates priority tagged frames as inner VLAN
4097 - special value: wildcard; only the outer VLAN is to be checked,
the presence or non-presence of an inner VLAN will not be
checked (default)
65535 - special value: no inner VLAN;
the outer VLAN is checked and if an inner VLAN is found,
there will be no match.
NOTE
If this parameter is set to 4096, 4097 or 65535,
sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleInnerVlanEnd will be ignored.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleInnerVlanBegin

description: This configuration parameter specifies the end of the inner VLAN
range used to assign the DHCPv4 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the inner VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs ending with this value.
4096 - special value: indicates priority tagged frames as inner VLAN
4097 - special value: wildcard; only the outer VLAN is to be checked,
the presence or non-presence of an inner VLAN will not be
checked (default)
65535 - special value: no inner VLAN;
the outer VLAN is checked and if an inner VLAN is found,
there will be no match.
NOTE
This parameter is ignored, if the sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleInnerVlanBegin
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpProviderVlanAssignmentRuleInnerVlanEnd

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpProviderAssignControlTimeStamp

description: The priority value of this assignment rule table entry.
The maximum number of allowed priorities depend on the maximum number of possible rules.
This priority is used if various rules uses overlapping vlan ranges.
The rule with lowest priority value will match.
Rules with identical priority value are not allowed to use overlapping vlan ranges.
The value zero is not allowed here.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePppoeProviderVlanAssignmentRulePriority

description: This ProviderTable entry should be used by bridgePort's for PPPoE
if the PVID vlan of the bridgeport is member of the vlan list of this assignment rule.
The value zero is not allowed here.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePppoeProviderVlanAssignmentRuleProviderIndex

description: Name of the assigned provider table entry.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePppoeProviderVlanAssignmentRuleProviderName

description: This parameter allows the double tagged assignment of an PPPoE provider and defines the begin
of the outer VLAN range assignment of a PPPoE provider.
1..4093 -> this configuration means this outer VLAN is checked and the first vlan in the range
4097 -> this configuration means no outer VLAN is checked, only inner VID is checked
If a special vlan value (4097) is used parameter OuterVlanEnd will contain the same.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePppoeProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanBegin

description: This parameter allows the double tagged assignment of an PPPoE provider and defines the end
of the outer VLAN range assignment of a PPPoE provider.
1..4093 -> this configuration means this outer VLAN is checked and the last vlan in the range
4097 -> this configuration means no outer VLAN is checked, only inner VID is checked
This parameter is don't care if the parameter OuterVlanStart contain no dedicated vlan index.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePppoeProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanEnd

description: This parameter allows the double tagged assignment of an PPPoE provider and defines the begin
of the inner VLAN range assignment of a PPPoE provider.
1..4093 -> this configuration means this inner VLAN is checked and the first vlan in the range
4096 -> special value in case of priority tagged frame handling
4097 -> this configuration means only the outer VLAN is checked, inner VID is don't care (default for all old configurations)
65535 -> this configuration means the outer VLAN is checked, if there is an inner VLAN there is no match
If a special vlan value (4096, 4097 or 65535) is used parameter InnerVlanEnd will contain the same.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePppoeProviderVlanAssignmentRuleInnerVlanBegin

description: This parameter allows the double tagged assignment of an PPPoE provider and defines the end
of the inner VLAN range assignment of a PPPoE provider.
1..4093 -> this configuration means this inner VLAN is checked and the last vlan in the range
4096 -> special value in case of priority tagged frame handling
4097 -> this configuration means only the outer VLAN is checked, inner VID is don't care (default for all old configurations)
65535 -> this configuration means the outer VLAN is checked, if there is an inner VLAN there is no match
This parameter is don't care if the parameter InnerVlanStart contain no dedicated vlan index.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePppoeProviderVlanAssignmentRuleInnerVlanEnd

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderControlIndex

description: Name for easy profile handling.
Spaces and other special characters (: ?) are not allowed!!
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderProfileName

description: The source IP address used by the IGMP proxy
for join and leave messages in upstream direction
and for queries in downstream direction.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderProxyIpAddress

description: The Robustness Variable allows tuning for the expected
packet loss on a subnet. If a subnet is expected to be
lossy, the Robustness Variable may be increased. IGMP is
robust to (Robustness Variable-1) packet losses. The
Robustness Variable MUST NOT be zero, and SHOULD
NOT be one.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderRobustness

description: The frequency at which IGMP Host-Query packets (downstream)
are transmitted on this interface.
NOTE:
If the value is less than 128, the value represents the number
of seconds directly.
If the value is greater or equal to 128, the value represents
the number of seconds as an exponent of 2 (exp) and mantissa (mant)
as follows:
|1| exp | mant |
Values >= 128 are interpreted as follows
No. of seconds = (mant + 16) * (2 to the power of (exp + 3)).
For example, the maximum value of 255 is interpreted as:
mant = 15
exp = 7
No. of secs = (15+16) * 2 to the power of 10 = 31744.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderQueryInterval

description: The Max Response Time inserted into the periodic
General Queries. When the subscriber host doesn't
respond to IGMP query messages, it is unsubscribed from
the multicast group. It must be less than
the Query Interval.
NOTE:
If the value is less than 128, the value represents the number
of 1/10 seconds directly.
If the value is greater or equal to 128, the value represents
the number of 1/10 seconds as an exponent of 2 (exp) and mantissa (mant)
as follows:
|1| exp | mant |
Values >= 128 are interpreted as follows
No. of seconds = ((mant + 16) * (2 to the power of (exp + 3)))/10.
For example, the maximum value of 255 is interpreted as:
mant = 15
exp = 7
No. of secs = (((15+16) * 2 to the power of 10)/10) = 3174.4.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderQueryResponseInterval

description: The startup frequency at which IGMP Host-Query
packets (downstream) are transmitted on this interface.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderStartupQueryInterval

description: The Startup Query Count is the number of Queries sent out
on startup, separated by the Startup Query Interval.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderStartupQueryCount

description: The Last Member Query Interval is the Max Response Time
inserted into Group-Specific Queries sent in response to
Leave Group messages, and is also the amount of time between
Group-Specific Query messages. This value may be tuned to
modify the leave latency of the network. A reduced value
results in reduced time to detect the loss of the last
member of a group. The value of this object is irrelevant
if igmpInterfaceVersion is 1.
NOTE:
If the value is less than 128, the value represents the number
of 1/10 seconds directly.
If the value is greater or equal to 128, the value represents
the number of 1/10 seconds as an exponent of 2 (exp) and mantissa (mant)
as follows:
|1| exp | mant |
Values >= 128 are interpreted as follows
No. of seconds = ((mant + 16) * (2 to the power of (exp + 3)))/10.
For example, the maximum value of 255 is interpreted as:
mant = 15
exp = 7
No. of secs = (((15+16) * 2 to the power of 10)/10) = 3174.4.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderLastMemberQueryInterval

description: The Last Member Query Count is the number of Group-Specific
Queries sent before the router assumes there are no local
members.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderLastMemberQueryCount

description: The Unsolicited Report Interval is the time between
repetitions of a host's initial report of membership
in a group (upstream).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderUnsolicitedReportInterval

description: The Version 1 Router Present Timeout is how long a host
must wait after hearing a Version 1 Query before it may
send any IGMPv2 messages.
The time until the local router will assume that
there are no longer any IGMP version 1 members on the IP
subnet attached to this interface. Upon hearing any IGMPv1
Membership Report, this value is loaded to a timer. While
the timer is running, the local router ignores any IGMPv2
Leave messages for this group that it receives on
this interface.
With R2.8 and support of IGMPv3 these attribute means OlderVersionRouterTimeout.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderVersion1RouterTimeout

description: Configures all possible multicast addresses for IGMP on a per VLAN basis.
This parameter indicates whether this IGMP provider have the limitation on
the multicast group/packages or not.
Value can be true(1) or false(2).
False means all subscriber can join all multicast streams through to this whole VLAN if they are member
of this vlan (unlimited access).
True is the default state and means only configured groups/packages could be joined (limited access).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderVlanMulticastLimitation

description: The Robustness Variable allows tuning for the expected
packet loss on a subnet. If a subnet is expected to be
lossy, the Robustness Variable may be increased. IGMP is
robust to (Robustness Variable-1) packet losses. The
Robustness Variable MUST NOT be zero, and SHOULD
NOT be one.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderRobustness

description: The frequency at which IGMP Host-Query packets (downstream)
are transmitted on this interface.
NOTE:
If the value is less than 128, the value represents the number
of seconds directly.
If the value is greater or equal to 128, the value represents
the number of seconds as an exponent of 2 (exp) and mantissa (mant)
as follows:
|1| exp | mant |
Values >= 128 are interpreted as follows
No. of seconds = (mant + 16) * (2 to the power of (exp + 3)).
For example, the maximum value of 255 is interpreted as:
mant = 15
exp = 7
No. of secs = (15+16) * 2 to the power of 10 = 31744.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderQueryInterval

description: The Max Response Time inserted into the periodic
General Queries. When the subscriber host doesn't
respond to IGMP query messages, it is unsubscribed from
the multicast group. It must be less than
the Query Interval.
NOTE:
If the value is less than 128, the value represents the number
of 1/10 seconds directly.
If the value is greater or equal to 128, the value represents
the number of 1/10 seconds as an exponent of 2 (exp) and mantissa (mant)
as follows:
|1| exp | mant |
Values >= 128 are interpreted as follows
No. of seconds = ((mant + 16) * (2 to the power of (exp + 3)))/10.
For example, the maximum value of 255 is interpreted as:
mant = 15
exp = 7
No. of secs = (((15+16) * 2 to the power of 10)/10) = 3174.4.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderQueryResponseInterval

description: The startup frequency at which IGMP Host-Query
packets (downstream) are transmitted on this interface.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderStartupQueryInterval

description: The Startup Query Count is the number of Queries sent out
on startup, separated by the Startup Query Interval.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderStartupQueryCount

description: The Last Member Query Interval is the Max Response Time
inserted into Group-Specific Queries sent in response to
Leave Group messages, and is also the amount of time between
Group-Specific Query messages. This value may be tuned to
modify the leave latency of the network. A reduced value
results in reduced time to detect the loss of the last
member of a group. The value of this object is irrelevant
if igmpInterfaceVersion is 1.
NOTE:
If the value is less than 128, the value represents the number
of 1/10 seconds directly.
If the value is greater or equal to 128, the value represents
the number of 1/10 seconds as an exponent of 2 (exp) and mantissa (mant)
as follows:
|1| exp | mant |
Values >= 128 are interpreted as follows
No. of seconds = ((mant + 16) * (2 to the power of (exp + 3)))/10.
For example, the maximum value of 255 is interpreted as:
mant = 15
exp = 7
No. of secs = (((15+16) * 2 to the power of 10)/10) = 3174.4.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderLastMemberQueryInterval

description: The Last Member Query Count is the number of Group-Specific
Queries sent before the router assumes there are no local
members.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProviderLastMemberQueryCount

description: The Unsolicited Report Interval is the time between

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProfileVlanVersion

description: Status of the forwarding of IGMP Any Source Multicast (ASM) joins.
VALUES
enable(1) - permit forwarding of both Any Source Multicast (ASM) joins
and Source Specific Multicast (SSM) joins
(default)
disable(2) - disable forwarding of ASM joins (only SSM joins are forwarded)
asmOnly(3) - permit forwarding of ASM joins only (SSM joins are dropped)
(From SR5.1)
REVISION HISTORY
R2.8: New.
SR5.1: asmOnly(3) added.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProfileVlanASMStatus

description: It indicates whether IGMP CXU snooping mode is enabled on provider.
Value 0 is disable; value 1 is enable.
Default value is disable.
New parameter with SHE R2.8
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProfileVlanCxUSnoopingState

description: This parameter contains a list of indeces which points to valid entries of the sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable.
The octet string is a list of pairs of octets (MODIFIED with R3.7M) each identify one valid SourceIpAddressTableEntry value.
The list could be empty (default).
If the configured sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId of related group's points to index with IP address 0.0.0.0
(wildcard configuration, ASM), any IGMP report message in network direction is sent as IGMv3
ASM report. The DefaultSourceIdList configuration could never points to index with IP address 0.0.0.0.
If the defaultList contains entries pointing to other non-zero IP-addresses, those (all of them) are used to generate
an IGMPv3 SSM report packet in network direction.
In case of IGMP provider mode IGMPv3 or IGMPv3Compatible the default IP list is checked with
channel as key for any received ASM packet to determine the transmission mode (ASM,SSM) and
source address for packets sent in network direction.
This configuration is not valid for IGMPv2 provider mode.
This configuration here will be outvoted by a similar configuration for the related IgmpGroup.
New parameter with SHE R2.8 maintenance.
NOTE:
R3.7M modify the size of an single entry from 1 octet to 2 octets because of the expanded range of sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable!
Note 2:
Range expanded to 16000 possible entries with R4.7M.
Only possible on CXU-G1 board. All other CXU boards support a maximum of 4000 entries.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProfileVlanDefaultSourceIdList

description: To configure the querier's tagging mode on provider vlan base.
0 - default - use the same tagging as configured for the provider
1 - single-tagged
2 - double-tagged.
New parameter with SHE R3.8M/R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProfileVlanQuerierTaggingMode

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpGroupIsStatic

description: This is a index which points to valid entry of the sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable.
If the source IP of the index is 0.0.0.0, it should work as a '*' wildcard configuration
and no restriction of possible source ip addresses are made (*,G). This setting is also valid for
Igmpv2 usage.
The configuration of other source IP's is only valid if IGMPv3 is running.
New parameter with SHE R2.8.
NOTE:
If a dedicated sourceId was configured here, it is not allowed to set the parameter DefaultSourceIdList.
A modification is only possible if the group was not assigned to a McastGroupPackage.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId

description: This parameter contains a list of indeces which points to valid entries of the sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable.
The octet string is a list of pairs of octets (MODIFIED with R3.7M) each identify one valid SourceIpAddressTableEntry value.
The list could be empty (default).
If the configured sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId of these group points to index with IP address 0.0.0.0 (wildcard configuration, ASM)
any IGMP report message in network direction is sent as IGMv3 ASM report.
The DefaultSourceIdList configuration could never points to index with IP address 0.0.0.0.
If the defaultList contains entries pointing to other non-zero IP-addresses, those (all of them) are used to generate
an IGMPv3 SSM report packet in network direction.
In case of IGMP provider mode IGMPv3 or IGMPv3Compatible the default IP list is checked with
channel as key for any received ASM packet to determine the transmission mode (ASM,SSM) and
source address for packets sent in network direction.
This configuration is not valid for IGMPv2 provider mode.
This configuration here will outvote a similar configuration for the corresponding IgmpProvider.
New parameter with SHE R2.8 maintenance.
NOTE1:
R3.7M modify the size of an single entry from 1 octet to 2 octets because of the expanded range of sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable!
NOTE2:
If a dedicated sourceId was configured it is not allowed to set the parameter DefaultSourceIdList here.
Note 3:
Range expanded to 16000 possible entries with R4.7M.
Only possible on CXU-G1 board. All other CXU boards support a maximum of 4000 entries.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpMcastChannelDefaultSourceIdList

This configuration here will outvote a similar configuration for the corresponding IgmpProvider.
New parameter with SHE R2.8 maintenance.
NOTE1:
R3.7M modify the size of an single entry from 1 octet to 2 octets because of the expanded range of sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable!
NOTE2:
If a dedicated sourceId was configured it is not allowed to set the parameter DefaultSourceIdList here.
Note 3:
Range expanded to 16000 possible entries with R4.7M.
Only possible on CXU-G1 board. All other CXU boards support a maximum of 4000 entries.

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProfileVlanVersion

description: Status of the forwarding of IGMP Any Source Multicast (ASM) joins.
VALUES
enable(1) - permit forwarding of both Any Source Multicast (ASM) joins
and Source Specific Multicast (SSM) joins
(default)
disable(2) - disable forwarding of ASM joins (only SSM joins are forwarded)
asmOnly(3) - permit forwarding of ASM joins only (SSM joins are dropped)
(From SR5.1)
REVISION HISTORY
R2.8: New.
SR5.1: asmOnly(3) added.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProfileVlanASMStatus

description: It indicates whether IGMP CXU snooping mode is enabled on provider.
Value 0 is disable; value 1 is enable.
Default value is disable.
New parameter with SHE R2.8
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProfileVlanCxUSnoopingState

description: This parameter contains a list of indeces which points to valid entries of the sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable.
The octet string is a list of pairs of octets (MODIFIED with R3.7M) each identify one valid SourceIpAddressTableEntry value.
The list could be empty (default).
If the configured sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId of related group's points to index with IP address 0.0.0.0
(wildcard configuration, ASM), any IGMP report message in network direction is sent as IGMv3
ASM report. The DefaultSourceIdList configuration could never points to index with IP address 0.0.0.0.
If the defaultList contains entries pointing to other non-zero IP-addresses, those (all of them) are used to generate
an IGMPv3 SSM report packet in network direction.
In case of IGMP provider mode IGMPv3 or IGMPv3Compatible the default IP list is checked with
channel as key for any received ASM packet to determine the transmission mode (ASM,SSM) and
source address for packets sent in network direction.
This configuration is not valid for IGMPv2 provider mode.
This configuration here will be outvoted by a similar configuration for the related IgmpGroup.
New parameter with SHE R2.8 maintenance.
NOTE:
R3.7M modify the size of an single entry from 1 octet to 2 octets because of the expanded range of sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable!
Note 2:
Range expanded to 16000 possible entries with R4.7M.
Only possible on CXU-G1 board. All other CXU boards support a maximum of 4000 entries.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpProfileVlanDefaultSourceIdList

description: To configure the querier's tagging mode on provider vlan base.

1 - single-tagged
2 - double-tagged.

description: The last used Multicast IP-Address if a list of consecutive IgmpIpAddresses should be configured.
The parameter sheIgmpGroupControlIpAddress define the first IpAddresse of this list.
Only valid for the following commands:
-> createMultipleIgmpGroupsWithAddressRanges (632)
NOTE:
There is a restriction regarding the address ranges and their subnets.
The netmask for the start and stop value must be in the format: A.B.C.XXX-A.B.C.XXX.
So under this rule a max number of 256 (0..255) different MC-Ips could be used in a single command.
Example:
sheIgmpGroupControlIpAddress = 235.2.3.5 - sheIgmpGroupControlIpAddressEnd = 235.2.3.100 -> ok
sheIgmpGroupControlIpAddress = 235.2.3.5 - sheIgmpGroupControlIpAddressEnd = 235.2.4.100 -> failure igmpMcastIpAddressRangeConflict(2201)
New parameter with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpGroupControlIpAddressEnd

description: This is a index which points to valid entry of the sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable.
If the source IP of the index is 0.0.0.0, it should work as a '*' wildcard configuration
and no restriction of possible source ip addresses are made (*,G). This setting is also valid for
Igmpv2 usage.
The configuration of other source IP's is only valid if IGMPv3 is running.
The configuration is only valid if IGMPv3 is running.
New parameter with SHE R2.8.
NOTE:
If a dedicated sourceId was configured here, it is not allowed to set the parameter DefaultSourceIdList.
A modification is only possible if the group was not assigned to a McastGroupPackage.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpMcastChannelControlSourceId

description: The last used index which points to valid entry of the sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable if a list of
consecutive sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTableEntrys should be configured.
The parameter sheIgmpMcastChannelControlSourceId define the first index of this list.
This is a index which points to valid entry of the sheIgmpSourceIpAddressTable.
Only valid for the following commands:
-> createMultipleIgmpGroupsWithAddressRanges (632)
NOTE:
There is a restriction regarding the address ranges and their subnets.
The netmask for the start and stop value must be in the format: A.B.C.XXX-A.B.C.XXX.
So under this rule a max number of 254 (.1 .. .254) different Source-Ips could be used in a single command.
Example:
sheIgmpMcastChannelControlSourceId -> 235.2.3.5 - sheIgmpMcastChannelControlSourceIdEnd -> 235.2.3.100 -> ok
sheIgmpMcastChannelControlSourceId -> 235.2.3.5 - sheIgmpMcastChannelControlSourceIdEnd -> 235.2.4.100 -> failure igmpSourceIpAddressRangeConflict(2202)
New parameter with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpMcastChannelControlSourceIdEnd

description: The used mapping of list parameters.
New parameter with R4.7M.
Valid for the following command:
-> createMultipleIgmpGroupsWithAddressRanges (632)
If the mapping is oneToOne(0) -> group ip is one - to - one to source ip
If the mapping is fullMesh(1) -> the full mesh of group ip and source ip
If the mapping is oneToOne(0), the number of given group ip's must match the number of given source id's (igmpRangeConfigMappingConflict(2205))!
Example:
sheIgmpGroupControlIpAddress = 239.1.1.1
sheIgmpGroupControlIpAddressEnd = 239.1.1.3
sheIgmpMcastChannelControlSourceId = 1
sheIgmpMcastChannelControlSourceIdEnd = 3
sheIgmpGroupControlListMapping = onToOne(0) -> NE create 3 new igmp groups
1. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.1 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 1
2. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.2 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 2
3. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.3 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 3
sheIgmpGroupControlListMapping = fullMesh(1) -> NE create 9 new igmp groups
1. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.1 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 1
2. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.2 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 1
3. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.3 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 1
4. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.1 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 2
5. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.2 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 2
6. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.3 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 2
7. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.1 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 3
8. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.2 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 3
9. sheIgmpGroupIpAddress = 239.1.1.3 and sheIgmpMcastChannelSourceId = 3
Valid for the following commands:
-> assignMultipleIgmpGroupToMcastPackages (635)
-> removeMultipleIgmpGroupsFromMcastPackages (636)
If the mapping is oneToOne(0) -> group index is one - to - one to McastPackageIndex
If the mapping is oneToMany(2) -> n:1 or 1:n but not full mesh of group index and McastPackageIndex is supported
The mapping fullMesh(1) is NOT supported for these commands!
If the mapping is oneToOne(0), the number of given group indices must match the number of given mcast packages (igmpRangeConfigMappingConflict(2205))!
Example:
sheIgmpGroupControlIndex = 1
sheIgmpGroupControlIndexRangeEnd = 3
sheIgmpGroupControlMcastGroupPackageList = '0x0001 0x0002 0x0003'
sheIgmpGroupControlListMapping = oneToOne(0) -> one group will be assigned/removed to/from one package
1. group 1 to/from package 1
2. group 2 to/from package 2
3. group 3 to/from package 3
Example:
sheIgmpGroupControlIndex = 1
sheIgmpGroupControlIndexRangeEnd = 1
sheIgmpGroupControlMcastGroupPackageList = '0x0001 0x0002 0x0003'
sheIgmpGroupControlListMapping = oneToMany(2) -> the group will be assigned/removed to/from each package
1. group 1 to/from package 1
2. group 1 to/from package 2
3. group 1 to/from package 3
Example:
sheIgmpGroupControlIndex = 1
sheIgmpGroupControlIndexRangeEnd = 3
sheIgmpGroupControlMcastGroupPackageList = '0x0001'
sheIgmpGroupControlListMapping = oneToMany(2) -> each group will be assigned/removed to/from package
1. group 1 to/from package 1
2. group 2 to/from package 1
3. group 3 to/from package 1

description: The index of the bridgePort to be configured.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndex

description: The last bridgeport index parameter if a list of consecutive bridgePortTableEntrys should be configured.
The parameter sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndex define the first index of this list.
Only valid for the following commands:
-> setMultipleIgmpBridgePortConfigsMcastGroupPackageList (641)
-> removeMultipleIgmpBridgePortConfigsMcastGroupPackageList (642)
NOTE:
There is a restriction regarding the bridgeport ranges.
It is not allowed to configure bridgeports placed on different cards by one command.
It is not allowed to configure bridgeports related to different VccTp's by one command.
Example:
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndex = 1011 - sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexEnd = 1091 -> ok
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndex = 1011 - sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexEnd = 2031 -> failed igmpBridgeportRangeConflict(2203) -> different cards selected
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndex = 1011 - sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexEnd = 1034 -> failed igmpBridgeportRangeConflict(2203) -> different VccTp's selected
New parameter with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexEnd

description: That is a list of corresponding indices of the sheIgmpMcastGroupPackageTable for all packages
containing mcast group's which could be joined by this subscriber.
Each index has 16 bit.
If no package is assigned, the string has 0 length.
NOTE:
New parameter with R3.7M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlMcastGroupPackageList

description: The used mapping of list parameters.
New parameter with R4.7M.
Valid for the following commands:
-> setMultipleIgmpBridgePortConfigsMcastGroupPackageList (641)
-> removeMultipleIgmpBridgePortConfigsMcastGroupPackageList (642)
If the mapping is oneToOne(0) -> bridgeport index is one - to - one to McastPackageIndex
If the mapping is oneToMany(2) -> n:1 or 1:n but not full mesh of bridgePort index and McastPackageIndex is supported
The mapping fullMesh(1) is NOT supported for these commands!
If the mapping is oneToOne(0), the number of bridgeport indices must match the number of given mcast packages (igmpRangeConfigMappingConflict(2205))!
Example:
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndex = 1011
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexEnd = 1031
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlMcastGroupPackageList = '0x0001 0x0002 0x0003'
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexListMapping = oneToOne(0) -> one package will be assigned/removed to/from one bridgeport
1. package 1 to/from bridgeport 1011
2. package 2 to/from bridgeport 1021
3. package 3 to/from bridgeport 1031
Example:
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndex = 1011
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexEnd = 1011
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlMcastGroupPackageList = '0x0001 0x0002 0x0003'
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexListMapping = oneToMany(2) -> each package will be assigned/removed to/from bridgeport
1. package 1 to/from bridgeport 1011
2. package 2 to/from bridgeport 1011
3. package 3 to/from bridgeport 1011
Example:
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndex = 1011
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexEnd = 1031
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlMcastGroupPackageList = '0x0001'
sheIgmpBridgePortConfigControlIndexListMapping = oneToMany(2) -> the package will be assigned/removed to/from each bridgeport
1. package 1 to/from bridgeport 1011
2. package 1 to/from bridgeport 1021
3. package 1 to/from bridgeport 1031

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCardQueueControlQueue8Watermarks

description: This parameter set the general queue mode for this card.
Depending on the used card type not all modes are available.
modeHQS will only be supported by DSL cards with Convergate chipset and only in downstream direction.
mode8QueueFlat will only be supported by VDSL2 and Shdsl2 cards and only in downstream direction.
mode4QueueFlat(1) -> 4 queues per port
mode8QueueFlat(2) -> 8 queues per port
modeHQS(3) -> 8 queues with hierarchical queuing and scheduling.
New parameter with R2.8.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCardQueueControlMode

description: This parameter is only valid for queuemode 'modeHQS' and is don't care for the others.
The queue of the second level scheduler (queuenumbers 1-4) in which the frames of the
first level scheduler will be enqueued could be selected here.
New parameter with R2.8.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCardQueueControlHqsSecondStageInputQueue

description: This parameter configures the peek information rate of the first stage scheduler if
queuemode modeHQS is running. Otherwise don't care.
Note:
The PIR of the first level queuing block should not be higher than the emission rate of the
respective second level queue into which the first level queues are enqueued.
The given value could be adapted (rounded) in the NE to fullfill different HW dependencies.
New parameter with R2.8.
NOTE:
Range:
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCardQueueControlHqsFirstStagePir

description: This parameter configures the peek burst size of the first stage scheduler if
queuemode modeHQS is running. Otherwise don't care.
New parameter with R2.8.
NOTE:
Range:
0..16383 in step of byte

description: ifIndex of the UNI interface where a shaping profile should be assigned

description: Actual protection state of the ERP domain on the ring.
The following three states are defined:
Normal - All ring nodes are available and used.
Protecting - At least one Link on the ring is failed.
Unknown - This state is used when the ERP protection
is not activated, or when the Multiple Failures are
detected in a Normal Node.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainRingStatus

erpDomainNodeStatus.

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpBaseControlTimestamp

description: This octet string with 4096 octets maps payload VLANs
to ERP domains: one octet containing the sheErpDomainIndex
per VLAN. The octet number is the sheVlanIndex.
You can assign a VLAN to only one ERP domain at a time.
In this way the ERP domains of the sheErpDomainTable
can be used on a per-VLAN basis. The value 0
indicates that no ERP domain is assigned to that VLAN.

description: The associated name of the ERP Domain.
Spaces and other special characters (: ?) are not allowed!!
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainName

description: The sheBridgePortIndex of the sheBridgePortTable
that represents the primary port of the ERP domain.
The allowed range is 1-65535. Only Ethernet interfaces
possible. The value -1 is used to indicate that
it is unassigned (Invalid).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainPrimaryPort

description: The sheBridgePortIndex of the sheBridgePortTable
that represents the secondary port of the ERP domain.
The allowed range is 1-65535. Only Ethernet interfaces
possible. The value -1 is used to indicate that
it is unassigned (Invalid).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainSecondaryPort

description: Time in seconds taken to verify that ring integrity is
maintained before switch to Idle state after all links
have recovered from Link Failure, Link Degrade or
Loss of Test Packet. Range 2..720.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainWaitToRestoreTime

description: Time interval , in milliseconds, between consecutive
transmission of test packets. The Test Packet Interval
is used to define the time to initiate protection due to
Loss of Test Packets, The value of Test Packet Interval
is between 10 ms and 500 ms in 10 ms steps.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainTestPacketInterval

description: Configures the time during which learning is disabled
after a FDB flush. The learning is only disabled for the
protected VLAN of the domain on the ERP ports.
The value of the Learning Disabled Time is between
0 and 500 ms in steps of 10 ms.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainLearningDisabledTime

description: An ERP domain may operate in two modes. RM Node or Normal
Node. The description of these two modes is included in
ERP concept specification. Only one node per domain
could be a rm node.
normalNode(1)
rmNode(2)
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainNodeMode

description: Represents the VLAN ID sheVlanIndex of the control VLAN
of the domain. The control VLAN may not be used in other
domains as control VLAN or as protected VLAN. The control
VLAN must be a VLAN with a high priority QoS profile.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainControlVlan

description: Erp domain Loss of Test Packet Trap.

deny(0)
permit(1)

permit(1)
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheErpDomainUlotpTrapEnable

permit(1)

description: Represents if ERP Protection activation is activated or
deactivated (admin state). When the ERP domain is activated the ERP
process will start running. All alarms/traps are cleared
and the ERP protection state is reported as unknown.
The domain will enter deactivated state. The ERP
protection activation default value is deactivated.
deny(0) - protection inactive
permit(1) - protection active

description: If applicable, indicates which instance of a component is
reporting the alarm. It is interpreted dependent on the
value of sheAlarmReportingSourceType as follows.
sheAlarmReportingSourceType | sheAlarmReportingSource
physicalEntity(1) | entPhysicalIndex
interface(2) | ifIndex
vccTp(3) | sheAdslVccTpIndex,
| sheShdslVccTpIndex
| sheXdslVccTpIndex
| (alarm OID determines scope)
vlan(4) | sheVlanIndex
bridgePort(5) | sheBridgePortIndex
erpDomain(6) | (obsolete)
voip(7) | sheVoipVgwIndex
vccTpShdsl(8) | (obsolete)
vccTpVdsl(9) | (obsolete)
l2cp(10) | sheL2cpIfIndex
syncSource(11) | sheSyncSourcePriority
pseudowire(12) | pwIndex
bfdSession(13) | (reserved for future use only)
syncT4Source(14) | sheSyncExtT4SourcePriority
voipSys(15) | (no relevance)
ntp(16) | (no relevance)
oamCfmMep(17) | (MaMegNetIndex << 16) + MepId
pseudowireGroup(18) | shePwVcRedGroupInstance
pmDataUpload(19) | sheSystemPMDataMaintenanceIndex
unknown(20) | (no relevance)
dataBaseBackup(21) | (no relevance)
igmpHistoryUpload(22) | entPhysicalIndex
swMaintenance(23) | (no relevance)
systemFileControl(24) | (no relevance)
systemConfigLog(25) | (no relevance)
vectoredSystem(26) | sheVectoredSystemIndex
vectoredCard(27) | entPhysicalIndex
vectorEnginePeer(28) | (sheVectoredCardVEPeerIndex << 24)
| + entPhysicalIndex
oamCfmGlobal(29) | (no relevance)
vectorEnginePort(30) | entPhysicalIndex
syncT4Out(31) | (no relevance)
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSource

description: Indicates the type or class of reporting source for the alarm.
Reporting source type determines how sheAlarmReportingSource
is to be interpreted. See sheAlarmReportingSourceType for a
full list.
A sheAlarmSeverityProfileEntry can be assigned to each
sheAlarmReportingSourceType within the MIB associated with
the sheAlarmReportingSourceType.
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSourceType

description: The severity of the alarm.
VALUES
critical(1)
major(2)
minor(3)
warning(4)
cleared(5)
Values 1..4 indicate that the alarm of the given severity has
been raised, the actual severity used being dependent on the
sheAlarmSeverityProfileEntry currently assigned to the
sheAlarmReportingSourceType.
Value 5 indicates that the alarm has been cleared.
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmSeverity

description: Unidirectional Loss of TestPackets state change trap.

Summary.eval: ($v4==5) ? 'Unidirectional loss of test packets alarm cleared' : 'Unidirectional loss of test packets alarm occurred'

description: Maximum traffic amount of type sheBcscThresholdType.
If the threshold of a traffic type is reached within
the 1 second measuring interval, further traffic of
that type is dropped during the next time period.

forwarded again during the next time period.

description: The MST configuration determines to which MST region
each switch belongs. The configuration includes the name
of the region, the revision number, and the MST
instance-to-VLAN assignment map.
For two or more switches to be in the same MST region
they must have the same VLAN-to-instance mapping
the same configuration revision number
and the same name.
The range of the revision number is 0 to 65535.

description: The MST configuration determines to which MST region

instance-to-VLAN assignment map.
For two or more switches to be in the same MST region
they must have the same VLAN-to-instance mapping
the same configuration revision number
and the same name.
The sheMstpBridgeProtoParamTable holds 32 static
profile entries of spanning tree protocol parameters.
A profile can be used on a per-VLAN basis.
This octet String with 4096 octets maps VLANs to
spanning tree protocol profiles:
one octet containing the sheMstpBridgeProtoParamIndex
per VLAN. The octet number is the sheVlanIndex.
You can assign a VLAN to only one spanning-tree
instance at a time.

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpControlBridgeProtoParamIndex

description: Each switch has an unique 8-byte bridge identifier
(bridge ID), which determines the selection of the
root switch. The two most-significant bytes are used
for the switch priority, and the remaining six bytes
are derived from the switch base MAC address.
When you change the switch priority value, you change
the probability that the switch will be elected as
the root switch. Configuring a higher value decreases
the probability; a lower value increases the
probability.
The configured value for the MstpBridgeProtoParamPriority should be completed
by a fixed offsett, depending on the Mstp-Instance ID. That means, a configured
priority-value of 4097 is valid for Mstp instance 1. Instance 2 will use 4098 in that case and instance 32 will have
a MstpBridgeProtoParamPriority of 4128.
Default value should be 32769 for MSTP-Instance 1 and 32800 for instance 32.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpBridgeProtoParamBridgePriority

description: Each switch has an unique 8-byte bridge identifier
(bridge ID), which determines the selection of the
root switch. The two most-significant bytes are used
for the switch priority, and the remaining six bytes
are derived from the switch base MAC address.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpBridgeProtoParamBridgeId

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpPortParamEntryModified SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpControlTimestamp u 9999 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpControlPortParamTableIndex u 1 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpPortParamAdminPathCost u 9999 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpPortParamPortPriority u 0 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpPortParamPortId s EX

description: Time stamp attribute set at the end of a command.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpControlTimestamp

description: A free running simple table index.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpControlPortParamTableIndex

description: When two interfaces on a switch are part of a loop
the spanning-tree port priority and path cost settings
determine which interface is put in the forwarding state
and which is put in the blocking state.
The path cost value represents media speed.
A lower path cost represents higher-speed transmission.
For cost, the range is 0 to 200000000; the default value
is derived from the media speed of the interface.
0 means auto selection by the system.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpPortParamAdminPathCost

description: When two interfaces on a switch are part of a loop
the spanning-tree port priority and path cost settings
determine which interface is put in the forwarding state
and which is put in the blocking state.
The port priority value represents the location of an
interface in the network topology and how well
it is located to pass traffic.
For priority, the range is 0 to 240. The default is 128.
The lower the number, the higher the priority.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpPortParamPortPriority

description: The parameter consists of two parts. One part bears a
fixed relationship to the physical or logical support of
the Port by real-world equipment; this part assures the
uniqueness of the Port Identifier among the Ports of a
single Bridge, and is a small integer assigned by the NE
in the range from one upwards. The other part of the
parameter allows adjustment of the priority of the
Port and is taken as the more significant part in
priority comparisons. The priority part of this parameter
can be updated by management.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMstpPortParamPortId
