description: Time stamp attribute set at the end of a command.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCistControlTimestamp

description: Each switch has an unique 8-byte bridge identifier
(bridge ID), which determines the selection of the
root switch. The two most-significant bytes are used
for the switch priority, and the remaining six bytes
are derived from the switch base MAC address.
When you change the switch priority value, you change
the probability that the switch will be elected as
the root switch. Configuring a higher value decreases
the probability; a lower value increases the
probability.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCistBridgeProtoParamBridgePriority

description: The maximum age of spanning tree protocol
information learned from the network on any port
before it is discarded (time a bridgeport saves its
configuration BPDU information), in units of hundredths
of a second. This is the actual value that this
bridge is currently using. This is 20 seconds by default
and can be tuned to be between six and 40 seconds.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCistBridgeProtoParamMaxAge

description: The value that all bridges use for HelloTime when
this bridge is acting as the root in units of hundredths
of a second. The hello time is the time between each
Bridge Protocol Data Unit (BPDU) that is sent on a port.
This is equal to two seconds by default, but can be tuned
to be between one and ten seconds. The granularity of
this timer is specified by 802.1D-1990 to be 1 second.
An agent may return a badValue error if a set
is attempted to a value which is not a whole number
of seconds.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCistBridgeProtoParamBridgeHelloTime

description: The value that all bridges use for ForwardDelay
when this bridge is acting as the root. Note that
802.1D-1990 specifies that the range for this
parameter is related to the value of
BridgeMaxAge. This time value, measured in units of
hundredths of a second, controls how fast a port changes
its spanning state when moving towards the Forwarding
state. The value determines how long the port
stays in each of the Listening and Learning
states, which precede the Forwarding state. This
value is also used, when a topology change has
been detected and is underway, to age all dynamic
entries in the Forwarding Database.
The granularity of this timer is specified by
802.1D-1990 to be 1 second. An agent may return a
badValue error if a set is attempted to a value which
is not a whole number of seconds.
This is by default equal to 15 seconds, but can be
tuned to be between four and 30 seconds.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCistBridgeProtoParamBridgeForwardDelay

description: When RSTP is configuring or reconfiguring the network
there is an increased and implementation dependent
probability that frames that are in transit will be
misordered or duplicated as network paths change
since a Bridge can buffer frames awaiting transmission
through its Ports. Some LAN protocols, for example
LLC Type 2, are particularly sensitive to frame
misordering and duplication; to support these the
Force Protocol Version parameter can be used to delay the
transition of ports to a Forwarding state and further
reduce the probability of such events.
The Force Protocol Version parameter for the Bridge
can take the value 0 (STP Compatibility mode),2
(the default, normal operation) or 3 (MSTP Compatibility).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCistBridgeProtoParamForceVer

description: Number of possible hops in the region. Only used if forcedVersion = mstp(3).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCistBridgeProtoParamMaxHops

description: Enable/Disable the stp self loop detection.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCistBridgeProtoParamSelfLoopDetect

description: Each switch has an unique 8-byte bridge identifier
(bridge ID), which determines the selection of the
root switch. The two most-significant bytes are used
for the switch priority, and the remaining six bytes
are derived from the switch base MAC address.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheCistBridgeProtoParamBridgeId

description: It notifies that the Ip Anti-Spoofing setting is changed.
If sheIpAntiSpoofingEnableis True, it indicates IP Anti-Spoofing Enable.
If sheIpAntiSpoofingEnable is False, it means IP Anti-Spoofing Disable.
Was set to obsolete with R3.7M.
Enable again with R4.0M!

Summary.eval: ($v1==1) ? 'IP anti-spoofing enabled' : 'IP anti-spoofing disabled'

description: True : Enable
False : Disable
NOTE for R2.8 and later releases:
There is an additional per bridgeport configuration for IpAs with R2.8 available
(sheBridgePortIpAsMode), which will be outvoted by this configuration if set to 'disable'.
This means that the bridgeports and global adminstate IPAS both have to be enabled to enable IPAS.
The configuration of the valid triple Ip-InnerTag-OuterTag will be done via DHCP or StaticIpAddress configuration.
Was set to obsolete with R3.7M.
Enable again with R4.0M/R4.7M!
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIpAntiSpoofingControlEnable

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMProbeAssignmentOnPortModified SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlTimeStamp u 9999 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlIndex i 9999 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlIndexType i 0 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlProbeAssignment i 0 SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlProbeReserveTime u 0

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlTimeStamp

description: Depending on the setting for shePVMPortControlIndexType this parameter
identify a entry in shePVMBridgePortTable or shePVMDslPortTable for configuration.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlIndex

description: Set the type of given index in shePVMPortControlIndex to identify a entry
for configuration.
Note:
R4.0M/R4.7M support only type dslPortIndex(1).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlIndexType

description: look at table.
Valid values:
none(0) -> release assigned probes directly
manual(1) -> manually probe assignment
automatic(2) -> NE should automatically assign a probe if threshold violation was detected
releaseAndReserve(3) -> used to release a propably assigned probe with an
additional probe secure time to prevent this probe from a direct
automatic reassignment to another port
-> the configured port will switch over to none(0) directly
-> additional the ProbeReserveTime should be set
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlProbeAssignment

description: The reserve time, were a probably assigned probe should not be automatically reassigned to
another port. This time should guarantee, that the operator could manually assign this probe
to a port of his choice.
Only valid if ProbeAssignment = releaseAndReserve(3)!
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlProbeReserveTime

description: Configuration event for long running commands.

description: Valid configuration commands and parameter.
enablePVMonPort (105):
-> enable feature or modify used profile if already enabled
shePVMPortControlIndex
shePVMPortControlIndexType
shePVMPortControlThresholdProfileName
disablePVMonPort (106):
-> diable feature
shePVMPortControlIndex
shePVMPortControlIndexType
configurePVMProbeAssignment (107):
-> only possible if feature is enabled on port
shePVMPortControlIndex
shePVMPortControlIndexType
shePVMPortControlProbeAssignment
shePVMPortControlProbeReserveTime -> optional, depend on ProbeAssignment
enablePVMLogging (110):
-> only possible if feature is enabled on port
shePVMPortControlIndex
shePVMPortControlIndexType
disablePVMLogging (111):
shePVMPortControlIndex
shePVMPortControlIndexType
New with R4.7M:
enablePVMMasMonitoring (112):
-> independent from PVM feature status on port
shePVMPortControlIndex
shePVMPortControlIndexType
disablePVMMasMonitoring (113):
shePVMPortControlIndex
shePVMPortControlIndexType

description: This parameter report the current status of MAS (mac antispoofing) monitoring.
The configuration is independent from the normal PVM observation.
If enabled, detected MAS occurences will be notified by events.
New parameter with R4.7M.

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::shePVMPortControlIndexType

description: This parameter report the type of policer, where these probe is assigned on.
Valid values:
protocolArp(1)
protocolDhcp(2)
protocolIgmp(3)
bridgePortandPriority(4) -> AssignmentInfo1 show the bridgePort and AssignmentInfo2 the .1p value
bridgePortandVlan(5) -> AssignmentInfo1 show the bridgePort and AssignmentInfo2 the vlan
dslPort(6)
bridgePort(7) -> AssignmentInfo1 show the bridgePort
bridgePortandVlanandPriority(8) -> AssignmentInfo1 show the bridgePort and
AssignmentInfo2 the vlan and AssignmentInfo3 the .1p value
protocolPppoE(9) -> New with R4.7M

description: sheMatDslamId has been changed.
A DSLAM ID used for IU's MAC address translation. MAT is performed based on this DSLAM ID.
The DSLAM ID should be interpreted as a hex value. Depending on the used MatTranslationMode
the following restrictions should be made:
TranslationMode:
world - The DSLAM ID should be a value between 0..4095 (0..FFF, 12 bits are valid)!
The not needed upper bits will be ignored.
ths - The DSLAM ID should be a value between 0..524287 (0..7FFFF, 19 bits are valid)!
The not needed upper bits will be ignored.
Default value is -1, that means a DSLAM ID is not assigned.
NOTE: A modified DSLAM ID need an IU reset for activation!
NOTE 2: Starting with R3.8M, the NE will generate automatically a uniqe DSLAM-ID field
on base of translation the inband IP address or MAC address.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMatDslamId

description: sheMatPortEnable has been changed.

Summary.eval: ($v1==1) ? 'MAT port enabled' : 'MAT port disabled'

description: Enable or disable the MAC address translation feature on bridgePort base.
NOTE:
This parameter will not longer supported with SHE R2.6. The enable/disable of this feature
will be done on VLAN base starting with this release.
Use new parameters in sheVlanTable therefor!!
With R2.8 the functionality is available in the NE again, but the configuration should directly
be done via sheBridgePortTable.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMatPortEnable

description: sheMatTranslationMode has been changed.
The attribute describes, which format for MAC address translation will be used.
general structure: byte5-byte4-byte3-byte2-byte1-byte0
world(1) -
byte 5 - DSLAM ID (bit 47-44, 4 bit) and identifier (0110)
byte 4 - DSLAM ID
byte 3 - slot number
byte 2 - port number
byte 1 - VCC number
byte 0 - MAC address index
ths(2) -
byte 5 - control (bit 47 = 0, bit 46 always 1, bit 45-40 no change)
byte 4,3,2 - DSLAM ID (bit 39-21, 19 bit)
byte 2,1 - slot number (bit 20-15, 6 bit)
byte 1,0 - port number (bit 14-6, 9 bits)
byte 0 - MAC address index (bit 5-0, 6 bits)
This translation mode will use an fix offset for selected MAC address indeces depending on the
fact, if the orginal MAc address was learned from a tagged or an untagged userframe.
NOTE1:
The mode ths(2) is obsolete with R4.7M!! A configuration of this mode is still possible
but will let to the same setting as mode thsNoIndexOffset(3).
thsNoIndexOffset(3) -
byte 5 - control (bit 47 = 0, bit 46 always 1, bit 45-40 no change)
byte 4,3,2 - DSLAM ID (bit 39-21, 19 bit)
byte 2,1 - slot number (bit 20-15, 6 bit)
byte 1,0 - port number (bit 14-6, 9 bits)
byte 0 - MAC address index (bit 5-0, 6 bits)
This translation mode will not use an offset for selected MAC address indeces depending on the
fact, if the orginal MAc address was learned from a tagged or an untagged userframe.
NOTE2:
R4.7M introduces two new mode names to renovate today's misleading and customer-specific syntax
as well as to homogenize parameter names for CLI and SNMP:
vMacAtm(4) -> use the same scheme as world(1)
vMacPort(5) -> use the same scheme as thsNoIndexOffset(3)
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheMatTranslationMode

description: The RuleList attribute provides an ordered list of (one or

sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTable.
Each index consists of two octets.
There can be maximum 4000 rules in the list.
Ordered list means that the filter part of the rules has to
be applied on the received frame one by one in the order
specified by the RuleList. On the first filter match the
frame shall be caught and the treatment part of the tagging
rule shall be executed.

description: Filter setting for outer tag priority.
VALUES
0..7 -> priority values
14 -> Do Not Filter, DNF, indicates that a tag must be
available but prio will not be checked
15 -> Shall Be Ignored , SBI, indicates that this entry
is the no-tag rule, i.e. untagged frames, and all
other outer tag filter fields should be ignored.
Assumes that
'sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltInnerPrio' is also
set to 'SBI(15)'.
NOTE:
R4.7M support all values, but there are additional IU card
specific restrictions regarding the support of such rules.
Single values will only be supported by nextGen DSL cards.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltOuterPrio

description: Filter setting for outer tag vid.
VALUES
1..4093 -> vid values
4096 -> special value to indicate priority tagged frames
4101 -> Do Not Filter, DNF
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltOuterVid

description: Filter setting for inner tag priority.
VALUES
0..7 -> priority values
14 -> Do Not Filter, DNF, indicates that a tag must be
available but prio will not be checked
Could only be set if the FiltOuterPrio was also
set != SBI
15 -> Shall Be Ignored , SBI, indicates that this entry
is not a double-tag rule and all other inner tag
filter fields should be ignored.
NOTE:
R4.7M support all values, but there are additional IU card
specific restrictions regarding the support of such rules.
Single values will only be supported by nextGen DSL cards.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltInnerPrio

description: Filter setting for inner tag vid.
VALUES
1..4093 -> vid values
4096 -> special value to indicate priority tagged frames
4101 -> Do Not Filter, DNF
NOTE:
R4.7M support all values, but there are additional IU card
specific restrictions regarding the support of such rules.
Single values will only be supported by nextGen DSL cards.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltInnerVid

description: Filter setting for Ethertype value(s).
VALUES
0..65535 -> Specific Ethertype value
(PMC-Sierra WinPath3-based ngVDSL IUs only)
e.g.
34915 (0x8863) -> PPPoE Discovery Stage
34916 (0x8864) -> PPPoE Session Stage
65536 (0x10000) -> Do Not Filter, DNF (Default)
65537 (0x10001) -> IP & ARP (Ethertypes 0x800 and 0x806)
65538 (0x10002) -> PPPoE Discovery Stage & PPPoE Session
Stage (0x8863 amd 0x8864)
NOTES
R4.7M, R4.7.1M, R4.7.2M: Only the special values >=0x10000

>=R4.7.3M: Only the special values >=0x10000 are supported

for PMC-Sierra WinPath3-based ngVDSL IUs.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltEthertype

description: Filter setting MultiTagging and admission policy.
VALUES
0 -> off, the frame must have the exact number of tag as
defined with FiltOuterPrio and FiltInnerPrio
1..6 -> exact number of maximum allowed vlan tags
255 -> unlimited
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltMultiTagging

description: This is the number of tags which has to be removed from the
frame before further treatment of the frame (e.g. adding tags)
starts.
Must be <= number of filtered tags!
VALUES
0..2 -> exact number of vlan tags
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatTagsToRemove

description: This parameter specifies which treatment option parameters are to be used: rule-specific or
bridgeport-specific.
VALUES
0 Use rule-specific treatment options;
the treatment parameters specified inside this rule entry will apply.
1..16 Use bridgeport-specific treatment options;
the value is the sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterIndex used to access the
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterTable of the associated bridgeport.
NOTE:
All other treatment option parameters specified in the rule will be disabled
and have no effect.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatmentParameterSet

description: Treatment setting for outer tag priority.
VALUES
0..7 -> priority values
8 -> inner priority of the received frame
9 -> outer priority of the received frame
10 -> inner priority of the bridgePort configuration
11 -> outer priority of the bridgePort configuration
12 -> use DSCP mapping defined in
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterDscpPrioMapIndex
14 -> Do Not Add, DNA (-> result will be, that also
TreatOuterVid and TreatOuterTpId will be set to
DNA)
NOTE:
This setting will only be used, if
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatmentParameterSet = 0
(use rule-specific treatment)
AND
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatForwarding = permit(1)
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterPrio

description: Treatment setting for outer tag vid.
VALUES
1..4093 -> vid values
4097 -> inner vid of the received frame
4098 -> outer vid of the received frame
4099 -> inner vid of the bridgePort configuration
4100 -> outer vid of the bridgePort configuration
4101 -> Do Not Add, DNA
NOTE:
This setting will only be used, if
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatmentParameterSet = 0
(use rule-specific treatment)
AND
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatForwarding = permit(1)
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterVid

description: Treatment setting for outer tag TpId.
This setting will only be used, if
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatmentParameterSet = 0
(use rule-specific treatment)
AND
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatForwarding = permit(1)
VALUES
4 -> fixedValue, TpId = 0x8100
8 -> bridgeBased, TpId value from globally
defined by sheBridgeBaseStagTPID shall be
taken
65536 (0x10000) -> Do Not Add, DNA
NOTES
- Setting outer TPID is not possible, if the target VLAN
has an explicit TPID configuration in the sheVlanTable
(sheVlanTpId).
- R4.7M/R4.7.1M only value bridgeBased(8) supported.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterTpId

VALUES

65536 (0x10000) -> Do Not Add, DNA

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatInnerTpId

description: This is a pointer to an instance of
sheBridgePortPriorityMapEntry defining the mapping of DSCP to
If sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterPrio is set to 12 (dscp),
this object must be set to a non-zero value as defined by the
SYNTAX clause.
VALUES
0 Treatment option disabled
1..16 Reference to an existing instance of
sheBridgePortPriorityMapEntry
IMPORTANT:
Convergate-based IU boards can only support ONE
DSCP to .1p Mapping Profile for all ports per
board, which means that for a given IU board:
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterDscpPrioMapIndex,
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatInnerDscpPrioMapIndex
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterOuterDscpPrioMapIndex,
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterInnerDscpPrioMapIndex
sheBridgePortPriorityMapIndex
sheBridgeIUDscpPriorityMapIndex.
can only ever be set to a single common value.
255 (0xFF) Use the IU specific assignment via
sheBridgeIUDscpPriorityMapIndex.
NOTE:
This setting will only be used, if
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatmentParameterSet = 0
(use rule-specific treatment)
AND
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatForwarding = permit(1)
AND
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterPrio = 12
NOTE:
Only a single priority map profile may be referenced by the
treatment options of a given tagging rule.
If both sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterDscpPrioMapIndex and
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatInnerDscpPrioMapIndex are
specified within the same tagging rule, they must reference
the same priority map profile!
New in R4.7.1M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterDscpPrioMapIndex

description: This is a pointer to an instance of
sheBridgePortPriorityMapEntry defining the mapping of DSCP to
If sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatInnerPrio is set to 12 (dscp),
this object must be set to a non-zero value as defined by the
SYNTAX clause.

0 Treatment option disabled
1..16 Reference to an existing instance of
sheBridgePortPriorityMapEntry
IMPORTANT:

DSCP to .1p Mapping Profile for all ports per
board, which means that for a given IU board:
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterDscpPrioMapIndex,
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatInnerDscpPrioMapIndex
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterOuterDscpPrioMapIndex,
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterInnerDscpPrioMapIndex
sheBridgePortPriorityMapIndex
sheBridgeIUDscpPriorityMapIndex.
can only ever be set to a single common value.
255 (0xFF) Use the IU specific assignment via
sheBridgeIUDscpPriorityMapIndex.
NOTE:
This setting will only be used, if
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatmentParameterSet = 0
(i.e., bridgeport Treatment Parameters not used)
AND
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatForwarding = forward(1)
(new in R4.7.1M).
NOTE:
Only a single priority map profile may be referenced by the
treatment options of a given tagging rule.
If both sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterDscpPrioMapIndex and
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatInnerDscpPrioMapIndex are
specified within the same tagging rule, they must reference
the same priority map profile!
New in R4.7.1M.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatInnerDscpPrioMapIndex

description: Specifies the forwarding permission for frames selected by the
filter option for this rule.
VALUES
permit(1) Frames selected by the associated filter option are
permitted to be forwarded, in which case the
treatment for the frames is specified by the
remaining treatment options.
deny(2) Frames selected by the associated filter option are
not permitted to be forwarded and are to be
discarded, in which case all other treatment
options are ignored.
NOTE:
This setting will only be used, if
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatmentParameterSet = 0
(use rule-specific treatment)
REVISION HISTORY
R4.7.1M. New.

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortEvmConfigControlTimeStamp

description: A descriptive unique name for this taggingRule.
Spaces and other special characters (: ?) are not allowed!!
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleName

description: Status report, if this rule is currently referenced by a evmProfile and therefore cannot deleted.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleInUse

description: Filter setting for outer tag priority.
VALUES
0..7 -> priority values
14 -> Do Not Filter, DNF, indicates that a tag must be
available but prio will not be checked
15 -> Shall Be Ignored , SBI, indicates that this entry
is the no-tag rule, i.e. untagged frames, and all
other outer tag filter fields should be ignored.
Assumes that
'sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltInnerPrio' is also
set to 'SBI(15)'.
NOTE:
R4.7M support all values, but there are additional IU card
specific restrictions regarding the support of such rules.
Single values will only be supported by nextGen DSL cards.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltOuterPrio

description: Filter setting for outer tag vid.
VALUES
1..4093 -> vid values
4096 -> special value to indicate priority tagged frames
4101 -> Do Not Filter, DNF
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltOuterVid

description: Filter setting for inner tag priority.
VALUES
0..7 -> priority values
14 -> Do Not Filter, DNF, indicates that a tag must be
available but prio will not be checked
Could only be set if the FiltOuterPrio was also
set != SBI
15 -> Shall Be Ignored , SBI, indicates that this entry
is not a double-tag rule and all other inner tag
filter fields should be ignored.
NOTE:
R4.7M support all values, but there are additional IU card
specific restrictions regarding the support of such rules.
Single values will only be supported by nextGen DSL cards.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltInnerPrio

description: Filter setting for inner tag vid.
VALUES

4096 -> special value to indicate priority tagged frames

Single values will only be supported by nextGen DSL cards.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTaggingRuleFiltInnerVid

description: Filter setting for Ethertype value(s).
VALUES
0..65535 -> Specific Ethertype value
(PMC-Sierra WinPath3-based ngVDSL IUs only)
e.g.
34915 (0x8863) -> PPPoE Discovery Stage
34916 (0x8864) -> PPPoE Session Stage
65536 (0x10000) -> Do Not Filter, DNF (Default)
65537 (0x10001) -> IP & ARP (Ethertypes 0x800 and 0x806)
65538 (0x10002) -> PPPoE Discovery Stage & PPPoE Session
Stage (0x8863 amd 0x8864)
NOTES
R4.7M, R4.7.1M, R4.7.2M: Only the special values >=0x10000
are supported.
>=R4.7.3M: Only the special values >=0x10000 are supported
on Lantiq Convergate-C based IUs
REVISION HISTORY
R4.7.3M: Restriction on support of values >=0x10000 removed
for PMC-Sierra WinPath3-based ngVDSL IUs.

R4.7M will only support value fixedValue(4) here.
NOTE:
This setting will only be used, if
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterForwarding = permit(1).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterInnerTpId

description: This is a pointer to an instance of sheBridgePortPriorityMapEntry defining the mapping of DSCP to .1p.
If sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterOuterPrio is set to 12 (dscp), this object must be set
to a non-zero value as defined by the SYNTAX clause.
VALUES
0 Treatment option disabled
1..16 Reference to an existing instance of sheBridgePortPriorityMapEntry
IMPORTANT:
Convergate-based IU boards can only support ONE DSCP to .1p Mapping Profile for all
ports per board, which means that for a given IU board:
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatOuterDscpPrioMapIndex,
sheBridgePortTaggingRuleTreatInnerDscpPrioMapIndex
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterOuterDscpPrioMapIndex,
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterInnerDscpPrioMapIndex
sheBridgePortPriorityMapIndex
sheBridgeIUDscpPriorityMapIndex.
can only ever be set to a single common value.
255 (0xFF) Use the IU specific assignment via sheBridgeIUDscpPriorityMapIndex.
NOTE:
This setting will only be used, if
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterForwarding = permit(1).
NOTE:
Only a single priority map profile may be referenced by the treatment options of a
given tagging rule.
If both sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterOuterDscpPrioMapIndex and
sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterInnerDscpPrioMapIndex are specified within the same
tagging rule, they must reference the same priority map profile!
New in R4.7.1M.

sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterOuterDscpPrioMapIndex,

sheBridgePortPriorityMapIndex

can only ever be set to a single common value.

NOTE:

description: Specifies the forwarding permission for frames selected by the filter option referencing this
instance of sheBridgePortTreatmentParameterEntry.
permit(1) Frames selected by the associated filter option are permitted to be forwarded,
in which case the treatment for the frames is specified by the remaining treatment
options.
deny(2) Frames selected by the associated filter option are not permitted to be forwarded and
are to be discarded, in which case all other treatment options are ignored.
New in R4.7.1M.

description: The priority assigned to this rule.
This priority is used if various rules use overlapping VLAN ranges.
The rule with lowest priority value will take precedence if more than
one rule matches. Rules with identical priority value are not allowed
to use overlapping VLAN ranges.
The maximum number of allowed priorities depends on the maximum number
of possible rules.
VALUES
1..65535 - priority

description: This configuration parameter specifies the beginning of the outer VLAN
range used to assign the ICMPv6 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the outer VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs beginning with this value.
4097 - special value: ignore outer VLAN; only the VID of the
inner VLAN is to be checked

If this parameter is set to 4097,
sheIcmpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanEnd will be ignored.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIcmpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanBegin

description: This configuration parameter specifies the end of the outer VLAN
range used to assign the ICMPv6 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the outer VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs ending with this value.
4097 - special value: ignore outer VLAN; only the VID of the
inner VLAN is to be checked
NOTE
This parameter is ignored, if the
sheIcmpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanBegin is set to 4097.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheIcmpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanEnd

description: This configuration parameter specifies the beginning of the inner VLAN
range used to assign the ICMPv6 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the inner VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs beginning with this value.
4096 - special value: indicates priority tagged frames as inner VLAN
4097 - special value: wildcard; only the outer VLAN is to be checked,
the presence or non-presence of an inner VLAN will not be
checked (default)
65535 - special value: no inner VLAN;
the outer VLAN is checked and if an inner VLAN is found,
there will be no match.
NOTE
If this parameter is set to 4096, 4097 or 65535,
sheIcmpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleInnerVlanEnd will be ignored.

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderName

description: Configures relay options for the DHCPv6 Relay Agent.
Options can be enabled by setting the corresponding bit.
The following options are available:
- INTERFACE-ID (RFC 3315 option 18, TR-177 R-07)
- REMOTE-ID (RFC 4649 option 37, TR-177 R-09)
- Vendor-specific Information (RFC 3315 option 17, TR-177 R-12)
Vendor-specific Information Option (option 17) allows the (Lightweight)
DHCPv6 Relay Agent to include vendor-specific data in the DHCPv6 messages
it forwards as configured for this provider. The use of this option is identical
to the use of the DHCPv4 vendor-specific information option as detailed in TR-101
Appendix D - DHCP Vendor Specific Options to Support DSL Line Characteristics.
VALUES
interfaceId(0) - Insert INTERFACE-ID
remoteId(1) - Insert REMOTE-ID
vendor(2) - Insert Vendor Specific Options to Support DSL Line Characteristics
NOTE
interfaceId(0) cannot be modified by setDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentOptions(24)
as long as only the lightweight DHCPv6-RA is supported by the NE.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: Set interfaceId as DEFVAL.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentOption

description: Configures DHCPv6 provider's access node identifier (ACCESS-NODE-ID) as string of
up to 63 characters.
The DHCPv6 Relay Agent substitutes the ACCESS-NODE-ID for the token %N in the
CIRCUIT-ID and REMOTE-ID options, if used.
IMPORTANT
Since the CIRCUIT-ID and REMOTE-ID strings are limited to 63 characters each
the user has to choose an ACCESS-NODE-ID, whose length is less than or equal to the
available total string length (63 chars) minus the lengths of the other format
strings used (depends on configuration).
If the resulting CIRCUIT-ID and REMOTE-ID strings exceed 63 characters, any trailing
characters will be truncated.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentAccessNodeIdentifier

description: Enable/disable DSL Line Characteristics DHCP Vendor-Specific Suboptions for this
DHCPv6 provider. Each suboption is enabled or disabled by setting or resetting
the corresponding BIT respectively.
This configuration is only applicable, if sheDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentOption
has enabled the insertsion of Vendor-specific Information (containing DSL Line
Characteristics (aka line properties)).
BIT Suboption Message Type ADSL/ADSL2/
ADSL2plus/
VDSL2 SHDSL
actualDataRateUs(0) 0x81 Actual Data Rate Upstream ok ok
actualDataRateDs(1) 0x82 Actual Data Rate Downstream ok ok
minimumDataRateUs(2) 0x83 Minimum Data Rate Upstream ok ok
minimumDataRateDs(3) 0x84 Minimum Data Rate Downstream ok ok
attainableDataRateUs(4) 0x85 Attainable Data Rate Upstream ok ok
attainableDataRateDs(5) 0x86 Attainable Data Rate Downstream ok ok
maximumDataRateUs(6) 0x87 Maximum Data Rate Upstream ok ok
maximumDataRateDs(7) 0x88 Maximum Data Rate Downstream ok ok
minimumDataRateLowPowerUs(8) 0x89 Minimum Data Rate Upstream in Low Power State ok n/a
minimumDataRateLowPowerDs(9) 0x8A Minimum Data Rate Downstream in Low Power State ok n/a
maximumInterleavingDelayUs(10) 0x8B Maximum Interleaving Delay Upstream ok n/a
actualInterleavingDelaysUs(11) 0x8C Actual Interleaving Delay Upstream ok n/a
maximumInterleavingDelayDs(12) 0x8D Maximum Interleaving Delay Downstream ok n/a
actualInterleavingDelaysDs(13) 0x8E Actual Interleaving Delay Downstream ok n/a
accessLoopEncapsulation(14) 0x90 Access Loop Encapsulation ok ok
dslType(15) 0x91 DSL type (type of transmission system in use) ok ok (new with R4.7M)
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentLinePropertySuboptions

SR5.1: New.
The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderControlTimeStamp

description: Configures relay options for the DHCPv6 Relay Agent.
Options can be enabled by setting the corresponding bit.
The following options are available:
- INTERFACE-ID (RFC 3315 option 18, TR-177 R-07)
- REMOTE-ID (RFC 4649 option 37, TR-177 R-09)
- Vendor-specific Information (RFC 3315 option 17, TR-177 R-12)
Vendor-specific Information Option (option 17) allows the (Lightweight)
DHCPv6 Relay Agent to include vendor-specific data in the DHCPv6 messages
it forwards as configured for this provider. The use of this option is identical
to the use of the DHCPv4 vendor-specific information option as detailed in TR-101
Appendix D - DHCP Vendor Specific Options to Support DSL Line Characteristics.
VALUES
interfaceId(0) - Insert INTERFACE-ID
remoteId(1) - Insert REMOTE-ID
vendor(2) - Insert Vendor Specific Options to Support DSL Line Characteristics
NOTE
interfaceId(0) cannot be modified by setDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentOptions(24)
as long as only the lightweight DHCPv6-RA is supported by the NE.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: Set interfaceId as DEFVAL.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentOption

description: Configures DHCPv6 provider's access node identifier (ACCESS-NODE-ID) as string of
up to 63 characters.
The DHCPv6 Relay Agent substitutes the ACCESS-NODE-ID for the token %N in the
CIRCUIT-ID and REMOTE-ID options, if used.
IMPORTANT
Since the CIRCUIT-ID and REMOTE-ID strings are limited to 63 characters each
the user has to choose an ACCESS-NODE-ID, whose length is less than or equal to the
available total string length (63 chars) minus the lengths of the other format
strings used (depends on configuration).
If the resulting CIRCUIT-ID and REMOTE-ID strings exceed 63 characters, any trailing
characters will be truncated.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentAccessNodeIdentifier

description: Enable/disable DSL Line Characteristics DHCP Vendor-Specific Suboptions for this
DHCPv6 provider. Each suboption is enabled or disabled by setting or resetting
the corresponding BIT respectively.
This configuration is only applicable, if sheDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentOption
has enabled the insertsion of Vendor-specific Information (containing DSL Line
Characteristics (aka line properties)).
BIT Suboption Message Type ADSL/ADSL2/
ADSL2plus/
VDSL2 SHDSL
actualDataRateUs(0) 0x81 Actual Data Rate Upstream ok ok
actualDataRateDs(1) 0x82 Actual Data Rate Downstream ok ok
minimumDataRateUs(2) 0x83 Minimum Data Rate Upstream ok ok
minimumDataRateDs(3) 0x84 Minimum Data Rate Downstream ok ok
attainableDataRateUs(4) 0x85 Attainable Data Rate Upstream ok ok
attainableDataRateDs(5) 0x86 Attainable Data Rate Downstream ok ok
maximumDataRateUs(6) 0x87 Maximum Data Rate Upstream ok ok
maximumDataRateDs(7) 0x88 Maximum Data Rate Downstream ok ok
minimumDataRateLowPowerUs(8) 0x89 Minimum Data Rate Upstream in Low Power State ok n/a
minimumDataRateLowPowerDs(9) 0x8A Minimum Data Rate Downstream in Low Power State ok n/a
maximumInterleavingDelayUs(10) 0x8B Maximum Interleaving Delay Upstream ok n/a
actualInterleavingDelaysUs(11) 0x8C Actual Interleaving Delay Upstream ok n/a
maximumInterleavingDelayDs(12) 0x8D Maximum Interleaving Delay Downstream ok n/a
actualInterleavingDelaysDs(13) 0x8E Actual Interleaving Delay Downstream ok n/a
accessLoopEncapsulation(14) 0x90 Access Loop Encapsulation ok ok
dslType(15) 0x91 DSL type (type of transmission system in use) ok ok (new with R4.7M)
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderRelayAgentLinePropertySuboptions

variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderAssignmentControlTimeStamp

description: The priority assigned to this rule.
This priority is used if various rules use overlapping VLAN ranges.
The rule with lowest priority value will take precedence if more than
one rule matches. Rules with identical priority value are not allowed
to use overlapping VLAN ranges.
The maximum number of allowed priorities depends on the maximum number
of possible rules.
VALUES
1..65535 - priority
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRulePriority

description: This configuration references an entry in the sheDhcpV6ProviderTable
that is to be used for DHCPv6 by bridgeports when they are a member
of the VLAN identified by the given rule.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleProviderIndex

description: Name of the assigned provider table entry.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleProviderName

description: This configuration parameter specifies the beginning of the outer VLAN
range used to assign the DHCPv6 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the outer VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs beginning with this value.
4097 - special value: ignore outer VLAN; only the VID of the
inner VLAN is to be checked
NOTE
If this parameter is set to 4097,
sheDhcpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanEnd will be ignored.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanBegin

description: This configuration parameter specifies the end of the outer VLAN
range used to assign the DHCPv6 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the outer VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs ending with this value.
4097 - special value: ignore outer VLAN; only the VID of the
inner VLAN is to be checked
NOTE
This parameter is ignored, if the
sheDhcpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanBegin is set to 4097.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleOuterVlanEnd

description: This configuration parameter specifies the beginning of the inner VLAN
range used to assign the DHCPv6 provider, if applicable.
VALUES
1..4093 - the VID of the inner VLAN is to be checked and
must match the range of VIDs beginning with this value.
4096 - special value: indicates priority tagged frames as inner VLAN
4097 - special value: wildcard; only the outer VLAN is to be checked,
the presence or non-presence of an inner VLAN will not be
checked (default)
65535 - special value: no inner VLAN;
the outer VLAN is checked and if an inner VLAN is found,
there will be no match.
NOTE
If this parameter is set to 4096, 4097 or 65535,
sheDhcpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleInnerVlanEnd will be ignored.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheDhcpV6ProviderVlanAssignmentRuleInnerVlanBegin

description: This configuration parameter specifies the end of the inner VLAN
range used to assign the DHCPv6 provider, if applicable.
VALUES

4096 - special value: indicates priority tagged frames as inner VLAN

description: The preferred lifetime for the IP session, expressed in units of seconds,
that the corresponding address or prefix will be in the 'preferred' state,
i.e. time until deprecation.
Deprecated addresses should no longer be used as a source address in
new communications, but packets received on such an interface are
processed as expected.
The preferred lifetime is derived from
DHCPv4 : lease time of IPv4 address
DHCPv6 : preferred lifetime of IPv6 address or prefix
SLAAC : preferred lifetime of IPv6 prefix
Static IP : always infinity
SPECIAL VALUE
4,294,967,295 (0xFFFFFFFF) - represents infinity.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortIpSessionPreferredLifeTime

description: The valid lifetime for the IP session, expressed in units of seconds,
that the corresponding address or prefix will be in the 'valid' state,
i.e. time until invalidation.
Invalid addresses should not appear as the destination or source address
of a packet.
The valid lifetime is derived from
DHCPv4 : lease time of IPv4 address
DHCPv6 : valid lifetime of IPv6 address or prefix
SLAAC : valid lifetime of IPv6 prefix
Static IP : always infinity
SPECIAL VALUE
4,294,967,295 (0xFFFFFFFF) - represents infinity.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortIpSessionValidLifeTime

description: The time elapsed since the session has been in use.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortIpSessionElapsedTime

description: The remaining length of time for the IP session, in seconds, for which
the corresponding address or prefix will continue to be valid, i.e.,
time until invalidation.
If an IP session becomes invalid, the corresponding MAC and IP addresses
will be deleted from MAC and IPAS tables and the corresponding entry in
IP session table will be removed.
SPECIAL VALUE
4,294,967,295 (0xFFFFFFFF) - represents infinity.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortIpSessionRemainingTime

description: This status parameter indicates whether this session has been saved for
for the feature SDR (Session Data Recovery).
VALUES
true(1) - session has been written to flash memory
false(2) - session has not been written to flash memory.
NOTE
Only supported for IPv4 DHCP sessions. For other session types, this
object always returns false(2).
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.

false(2) - IP anti-spoofing is inactive for this session.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortIpSessionAntiSpoofingIsActive

description: The preferred lifetime for the IP session, expressed in units of seconds,
that the corresponding address or prefix will be in the 'preferred' state,
i.e. time until deprecation.
Deprecated addresses should no longer be used as a source address in
new communications, but packets received on such an interface are
processed as expected.
The preferred lifetime is derived from
DHCPv4 : lease time of IPv4 address
DHCPv6 : preferred lifetime of IPv6 address or prefix
SLAAC : preferred lifetime of IPv6 prefix
Static IP : always infinity
SPECIAL VALUE
4,294,967,295 (0xFFFFFFFF) - represents infinity.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortIpSessionPreferredLifeTime

description: The valid lifetime for the IP session, expressed in units of seconds,
that the corresponding address or prefix will be in the 'valid' state,
i.e. time until invalidation.
Invalid addresses should not appear as the destination or source address
of a packet.
The valid lifetime is derived from
DHCPv4 : lease time of IPv4 address
DHCPv6 : valid lifetime of IPv6 address or prefix
SLAAC : valid lifetime of IPv6 prefix
Static IP : always infinity
SPECIAL VALUE
4,294,967,295 (0xFFFFFFFF) - represents infinity.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortIpSessionValidLifeTime

description: The time elapsed since the session has been in use.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortIpSessionElapsedTime

description: The remaining length of time for the IP session, in seconds, for which
the corresponding address or prefix will continue to be valid, i.e.,
time until invalidation.
If an IP session becomes invalid, the corresponding MAC and IP addresses
will be deleted from MAC and IPAS tables and the corresponding entry in
IP session table will be removed.
SPECIAL VALUE
4,294,967,295 (0xFFFFFFFF) - represents infinity.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-BRIDGE-MIB::sheBridgePortIpSessionRemainingTime

description: This status parameter indicates whether this session has been saved for
for the feature SDR (Session Data Recovery).
VALUES
true(1) - session has been written to flash memory
false(2) - session has not been written to flash memory.
NOTE
Only supported for IPv4 DHCP sessions. For other session types, this
object always returns false(2).
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
